TESS38: Jiub the Eradicator, Saint Jiub, Jiub

plots: NONE
title: Impatience of a Saint
objective: help Jiub find the first volume of his opus
tasks: collect the ten missing pages of Jiub's opus
description:
I am Jiub. Some call me Saint Jiub. Others call me Jiub the Eradicator. Perhaps you've heard of me?
If you haven't, I can't say that I am surprised. Until I get my second volume published, no one will ever know of my achievements. In order to write the second volume of my opus, I need the notes from my first volume. Otherwise I need to do all of this from memory.
When I was tossed in here I felt myself falling… and I dropped the pages I had been holding. There were ten of them in all.
Find them for me, please, I beg you!

plots: NONE
title: A Bard's Request
objective: bring an authoritative history of the Unicorn Run to Rinnie
tasks: find an authoritative history of the Unicorn Run
description:
"Sweet waters of the forest
flow through each den and glade
nourishing the unicorns
who lie graceful in the shade..."

I'm Rinnie, a bard and balladeer.
I have been working on a ballad about the Unicorn Run in the High Forest. I'd like to use a more reliable source than simply hearsay and folklore, though. If you ever find an authoritative history of the run in your travels, I'd love to get my hands on it.
A friend of mine gave me this Scroll of Protection From Poison and I have yet to make use of it, so you could have it as a reward.

plots: the player and Jauffre won't like Martin's plan to obtain a Great Sigil Stone
Great Sigil Stones are the anchors of Great Gates: the Mythic Dawn opened a Great Gate at Kvatch, and they want to open another one here to destroy Bruma
Martin was at Kvatch and saw the terrible power of the Daedric siege engine
the only way to recover the Amulet of Kings is to allow the Mythic Dawn to proceed with their plan to attack Bruma
title: Defense of Bruma
objective: have the Countess meet Martin in the Chapel of Talos for a council of war
tasks: explain Martin's plan to the Countess
description:
We need a Great Sigil Stone. You're not going to like it. Jauffre doesn't like it. The Countess of Bruma certainly isn't going to like it. Great Sigil Stones are the anchors of Great Gates. The kind of gate the Mythic Dawn opened at Kvatch. The kind of Gate the Mythic Dawn wants to open here to destroy Bruma.
The risk is great, I know. I was at Kvatch. I saw the terrible power of the Daedric siege engine. But we have no choice. The only way to recover the Amulet of Kings is to allow the Mythic Dawn to proceed with their plan to attack Bruma.
Please, my friend. I explain myself to you so you understand me. And so you can explain to the Countess. I'm afraid she may take a bit more convincing than you.
Have the Countess of Bruma meet me in the Chapel of Talos for a council of war. That seems a fitting place to make such desperate plans.

plots: Casson was killed for trespassing the Water Queen's House
Tremain Belde'ar wants to resurrect Casson
title: Tremain's Son
objective: bring Casson's body to Tremain Belde'ar
description:
Greetings to you. I am Lord Priest Tremain Belde'ar, a humble servant of Our Smiling Lady Tymora.
My request of you is an odd and very dangerous one. I will not hold you to it if you deem it too extreme. I would have you enter the Water Queen's House and retrieve my son's, Casson's, body. Casson sought to indulge his restless nature by sneaking about the place, and a high price was paid.
You must bring Casson's body to me, that I may restore his life to him.

plots: Firebead Elvenhair left his identify scroll to Tethtoril
title: Firebead's Scroll
objective: bring Firebead Elvenhair's identify scroll to him
tasks: get Firebead Elvenhair's identify scroll from Tethtoril
description:
I, Firebead Elvenhair, have a small errand for you.
I left an identify scroll with Tethtoril, in the inner grounds. He should be done examining it by now, so if you could fetch it for me, I'd be grateful. I have a great use for those types of scrolls.
Allow me to cast a little spell on you as a reward. It will protect you from any evil you might meet tonight.

plots: the player asked a recommendation from Teekeeus
Earana and Teekeeus have an unpleasant history: Earana does not care for Mages Guild regulations, and believes Teekeus is mis-using his powers
title: Teekeeus' Old Rival
objective: find a way to get rid of Earana
description:
I'm afraid I can't just write one out of hand. That would be against protocols, you see. If perhaps you can clear up a small matter involving Earana, you can prove your loyalty to the guild and earn my recommendation.
Earana and I have an unpleasant history. She does not care for Guild regulations, and errantly believes I am mis-using my powers. I have seen that she is in town. Though she has not approached me, I know she wants something.
I would like you to find out what it is. Determine what Earana's after, and how we may be rid of her. I do not want her here, spreading her lies.

TESS355: the tundra a bit west of Whiterun
TESS356: the tundra a bit west of Whiterun

plots: the player is torturing their prisoner: the prisoner wants to die
title: Kill Me and Be Done with It...
objective: find your prisoner's hidden treasure for yourself
tasks: get your prisoner's treasure from a hollowed-out rock
description:
Please... What is it you want?
Just... just stop. And I'll tell you where I've hidden my treasure. It's... in a hollowed-out rock. In the tundra. A bit west of Whiterun. Now please... please stop.
Oh gods, you've taken everything I have. Just kill me and be done with it...

plots: Illia just killed a female witch in front of the player
Illia and the witch were supposed to find a human sacrifice: the witch attacked Illia because Illia could not do it
title: Repentance
objective: help Illia prevent her mother from transforming into a Hagraven
tasks: follow Illia to the top of the tower
description:
By the gods! I know this looks bad. Let me explain...
I called Darklight Tower home, now I know that was a mistake. I am, or was part of a coven serving the Hagravens that live there. So was she.
We were supposed to find a sacrifice. Human sacrifice. I told her I couldn't do it and she attacked me. I've done horrible things living here, but never taken an innocent life. I couldn't just find some person for them to kill. We needed a sacrifice for the Initiation. My mother is going to become one of those things, Hagravens. I can't be a part of that. Gods, I can't run away from this.
I'm going up there to stop her. This cycle must end. I don't know what brought you here, but I could use your help, if you're willing. Follow me. We have to fight our way up the Tower. I don't think anyone else here is about to have a change of heart.

plots: Rosentia Gallenus bought a cheap Daedric Staff: four scamps appeared after Rosentia Gallenus spoke the runic word carved on the Daedric Staff while holding it
the four scamps follow Rosentia Gallenus everywhere
Rosentia Gallenus can't compel herself to let go of the Daedric Staff
title: Whom Gods Annoy
objective: make the scamps go away from Rosentia Gallenus' home
description:
These stupid scamps are driving me crazy! I'm at my wit's end! I, Rosentia Gallenus, beg you to help me!
The beastly little creatures are nasty, smelly, noisy and wrecking my beautiful house! I must be rid of them! I can't let people know I have scamps in here, or they'll think I've taken to Daedra worship. Try explaining that to the town guard.
I had a feeling buying that Daedric Staff would be trouble. Now I'm paying for it with more than just some gold. A few weeks ago, a spellsword was passing through Leyawiin and heard that I like to buy curiosities. He wanted to sell the staff you see me carrying. I eagerly bought it, knowing the value of Daedric relics. In fact, I was a bit suspicious when he sold it so cheap. His loss, my gain I figured. After examining it for a bit I noticed a small word carved on it in runes. Using a book from my library, I translated it. The word was nonsense. However, when I spoke it and held the staff, four scamps suddenly appeared! I thought I was done for! Strangely, they all just stood there. It didn't take long before I realized they were following me! I couldn't be seen in town with scamps following, so I decided to discard the staff. I can't explain it, but somehow I can't compel myself to actually let it go. This staff is obviously cursed! Now I'm stuck with it.
Oh please, I beg you! Take this staff to Darkfathom Cave and get rid of it and the scamps forever! I can't fight, and who knows what's guarding the shrine? Plus, do you know how dirty caves are? It'll ruin anything I wear!
Do this for me, and I'll reward you with another one of my curios I picked up a few years ago... a valuable ring. Ring of Eidolon's Edge.

TESO554: during the day, out under the waves in the bay
TESO555: during the day, out under the waves in the bay

plots: the player told Tooth-in-the-Sea that they want to learn Alteration from him
the player must stay underwater with Tooth-in-the-Sea for three hours: the player must not wander off or they fail the test
title: Alteration Training
objective: prove Tooth-in-the-Sea that you are worthy of Alteration training
description:
Would you learn from me? Then meet me during the day, out under the waves in the bay.
If you wish to learn what I know about Alteration, then you must stay there with me for a full three hours. How you manage to do this is up to you; do not wander off, or I shall consider this test of your ability failed.

plots: the player stumbled upon Christer while exploring Mistwatch
Christer heard that bandits in Mistwatch ransom captives and thinks that Fjola might be one of them: he managed to sneak in and look for Fjola, but he is not a warrior
Christer gives the player a key that will come in handy
title: Mistwatch
objective: help Christer locate Fjola
description:
Please, stranger! I need your help! Divine mercy - you aren't one of the bandits. Please, you've got to help me!
It's my wife, Fjola! I think she's being held in this tower. Let me explain. Fjola, my wife, left the farm on errands and never came back. It's been months, and I've been searching for her since. I heard a rumor that these bandits were ransoming captives, so I thought she may be here. I managed to sneak past the guards and get this far, but... I don't think I can go on. I'm no warrior! Please, can you look for her?
I don't have much, but I can give you some coin for the trouble. One of the guards dropped this key while I hid. I wager it will come in handy for you. Please hurry!

plots: Legate Rikke is addressing the player and the player's fellow legionnaires: the Imperial legion will send a message to Ulfric and the rebel Jarls who support him
title: Weather the Storm
objective: protect Whiterun from the Stormcloak invasion
description:
This is it men! This is an important day for the Empire and for the Legion. And for all of Skyrim.
This is the day we send a message to Ulfric and the rebel Jarls who support him. We will protect Whiterun from Stormcloaks. But make no mistake. What we do here today, we do for Skyrim and her people. By cutting out the disease of this rebellion, we will make this country whole again!
Ready now! Everyone, with me! For the Empire! For the Legion!

BG1109: north of the Friendly Arms Inn
BG1112: north of the Friendly Arms Inn

plots: NONE
title: Joia's Flamedance Ring
objective: return Joia's Flamedance Ring to her
tasks: find the hobgoblins who stole Joia's Flamedance Ring
description:
Hey there, you're new here, aren't you? Could I, Joia, trouble you a moment?
I need someone to go club some heads for me. I was ambushed by a band o' hobgoblins within sight of this inn's walls. Robbed me blind, they did, and I want to return the favor.
I don't care about most of my things, but I want to get my ring back. My father gave it to me, you understand? The creatures were just north of the inn. Bring my ring back here when you get it. You'll know it when you see it. It's a Flamedance Ring, and very striking.

TESS677: books, which contain powerful Illusion spells

plots: Drevis Neloren has taught the player all he knows about Illusion magic
title: In Plain Sight
objective: bring 4 books to Drevis Neloren
tasks: use the spell that Drevis Neloren teaches you to locate the 4 books
description:
You have gone beyond my teachings, which is quite a feat. I did not think it possible. But there is always more to learn. I believe you are ready for the next step. Knowledge of truly powerful Illusion spells is here at the College, but it is hidden from those who might misuse it.
I shall teach you a spell to discern things hidden from others. With it, you will be able to acquire the texts you need. Bring all four to me, and I shall use them to inscribe the spells for you.

plots: NONE
title: Work is Never Done
objective: help Tove build a sky boat from calipers and tongs
tasks: sell calipers and tongs to Tove
description:
Hello, my name is Tove. "The Unrestful," they call me. So much to do, and so little time. There's only one of me to go around, you know!
I keep forgetting that most people don't remember when we'll meet in the future. Wait, this is yesterday's future. I'm the one that's confused. Anyway, you're going to help me find calipers and tongs. No point in denying it. You've already agreed tomorrow.
I'm using them to build my skyboat. Just between you and me, the hardest part has been getting the water to not fall out of the air. Now if I can just get the water to fly through the air. That's what the calipers and tongs are for. I need them to keep the water airborne.
Are you willing to sell me calipers and tongs? Five gold each, just like I told you next week.

plots: Gogan was robbed by the all-female gang: Maelona's family heirloom was among the things that the gang took from him
the city guard have not done much about the all-female gang: the men they rob are too embarrassed to report the gang
title: The Siren's Deception
objective: get Maelona's family heirloom back from an all-female gang of thieves that prey on the married men of Anvil
tasks: find leads about the all-female gang
description:
I'm Maelona. How would you like to get my husband, Gogan, out of hot water?
Believe me, he'll need all the help he can get to worm his way out of this one. To think he'd fall for the gang's scheme... agh! I could kill him! I'm sorry... I'm rambling and got you confused. Let me explain.
The women in the gang use their wiles to lure men out to some remote location and rob them blind. It's been going on for some time now. The city guard hasn't done very much about it, because frankly, the men who are robbed are so embarrassed, they don't want to report it. Take for example that good-for-nothing husband of mine, Gogan. He cared more about their charms than my own.
When Gogan was, uh... with the women, they took something quite valuable from him. No... it's not what you're thinking. He was carrying a precious family heirloom with him when he was lured out to their lair. It was a small ring given to him on our wedding day. The ring belonged to my mother, and has been in the family for generations. I'm willing to give you all the money I have to get it back. 100 gold. Can you help us?
All I can tell you is that the best place to start is at The Flowing Bowl. It's a tavern located outside the city walls near the waterfront. The Flowing Bowl attracts the worst Anvil has to offer. Always be on your guard.

plots: Raynil Dralas killed Bradon in Bradon and Erline's home: the Bruma city watch found the body of a dead beggar in Bradon and Erline's's home afterwards
Raynil Dralas convinced Carius that Bradon was a vampire
no one has seen Bradon out in the daylight: Erline explains that Bradon works at night and sleeps on days
Erline has seen Raynil Dralas before
title: A Brotherhood Betrayed
objective: clear Bradon's name
tasks: find Raynil Dralas, and make him tell you the truth about Bradon's supposed vampirism
description:
I can't believe this is happening. Please... please. I need your help. My husband was no vampire! It's ridiculous! No one will listen to me! Forgive me. I loved my husband dearly, and to lose him this way makes no sense. Anything you can do to help would be wonderful. This is all happening so fast.
I came home only just a few hours ago. I found the door open, and my Bradon dead. Standing over him was a Dunmer. I screamed and ran out into the street. Some city watch were nearby and heard me I suppose, as they arrived quickly. I heard the Dunmer identify himself as Raynil Dralas. He said he was a vampire hunter and that Bradon was his mark. The guards seemed to know about Raynil, and after a search of the house, the body of some beggar was found stashed in our basement. The guards sent for Carius, who is an investigator for crimes here in Bruma. In minutes, Raynil convinced Carius that Bradon was a vampire.
Why would he stash a body in his own house? That's ridiculous! And another thing. The guards are making a big deal out of no one seeing Bradon out in the daylight. Well of course that's the case! He works at night, and has to sleep during the day. Why does that make him a vampire? It's all that Raynil character. I don't trust him. The thing that bothers me the most is that I swear I've seen him before. Of course he says he's never been here. Look, there isn't much more to say. Please... help me clear my husband's name.
Just find Raynil Dralas, and make him tell you the truth. I swear, he's a liar!

plots: the player's fellow members of the Fighters Guild have been causing issues at the tavern in Leyawiin
title: Drunk and Disorderly
objective: find out why several of your fellow members of the Fighters Guild are causing trouble in Leyawiin
tasks: find out what is wrong with Rellian, Vantus Prelius, and Dubok gro-Shagk
description:
Back for more work, are you? Good. Some of our boys are causing trouble in Leyawiin. Looks bad for the guild.
Some of your brothers have been getting rowdy at the local tavern. I've got no problem with cutting loose, but I don't like it when we all look bad. You're looking for Rellian, Vantus Prelius, and Dubok gro-Shagk. I haven't had any trouble with them before, so find out what's going on.
I'll be waiting.

plots: Lord Drad took Malacath's ogres: ogres are Malacath's little brothers
Lord Drad put Malacath's ogres in chains, working in the mines
title: Malacath's Family of Monsters
objective: rescue ogres from slavery under Lord Drad
tasks: let Malacath's ogres loose and get them out of Lord Drad's mines
description:
You want something from Malacath? Then, if you're smart, you do what I tell you.
Lord Drad took my ogres. Says he owns them. Lying maggot! They're MY ogres! Lord Drad put my little brothers in chains, working in the mines. I don't like that.
Get over to Lord Drad's estate. Let my ogres loose, and get them out! Okay? Get going!
You get a present, Volendrung. Be nice to my little brothers!

plots: NONE
title: Joining the Stormcloaks
objective: prove yourself worthy of becoming a Stormcloak
description:
The Stormcloaks need dedicated men and women who're devoted to the cause and willing to die for it. Before I can put you to use, I need to know how much you can take. I have a little test for you.
I'm sending you to Serpentstone Isle. If you survive, you pass. If you die, well, you weren't going to be much use to me anyway. It's where men have tested their mettle for ages. There's a strange rock formation, built by the ancients. Something about that place attracts the Ice Wraiths.
You kill an Ice Wraith out there, and I'll have all the proof I need about you being Stormcloak material.

plots: the player saved Selveni Nethri from a spiders' web
Selveni Nethri was a member of Bashnag's coven, but they chased her out and left her for dead
title: The Savior of Selveni Nethri
objective: help Selveni Nethri escape from Southfringe Sanctum
description:
Thanks for getting me out of that. Bashnag's coven chased me out and left me for dead down here. Nobody lasts too long with the spiders.
Please, will you help me get out of here? If the coast is clear, I'll make a break for it. We - well 'they', Bashnag's circle of mages, live here. They made it pretty clear that I'm no longer welcome. These are no dainty college mages. Bashnag has the skill of a magister and the mind of a warlord.
This is a dangerous bunch. They're good company if you want to study necromancy in peace, though.

TESO310: Herminia Cinna's home, in the Imperial City, the Elven Gardens district

plots: the player has obtained Ayleid artifacts for Umbacano before
Herminia Cinna refuses to sell the Crown of Nenalata to Umbacano
Umbacano needs to go to Nenalata in order to bring his research on the last king of the Ayleids to its final stage
title: Secrets of the Ayleids
objective: escort Umbacano to the Throne Room of Nenalata
tasks: try to buy the Crown of Nenalata from Herminia Cinna
description:
I have another job for you. This is not quite in your usual line of work, but I hope you can help me just the same.
A rival collector has an item, the Crown of Nenalata, which I very much want to add to my collection. But she stubbornly refuses to consider any of my offers. She and I have had our differences over the years, I admit. Now she is taking this opportunity to get her revenge. I believe that you may be able to persuade her to part with the item, where I cannot due to her prejudice against me. Her name is Herminia Cinna. She lives here in the Imperial City, in the Elven Gardens district.
I hope you will succeed where I have so far failed. Afterwards, in order to bring my research on the last king of the Ayleids to its final stage, I need to go to the Throne Room of Nenalata. While I am not without means of defending myself, I believe you would be an invaluable companion on such an expedition. Your reward will be whatever plunder you wish to carry off from Nenalata. Since the Throne Room has been sealed since the time of the Ayleids, it should provide rich pickings.

plots: the player asked Revyn Sadri whether something in his store is stolen
title: That Was Always There
objective: return Viola Giordano's gold ring to her without her knowing
tasks: sneak inside the house and place Viola Giordano's gold ring in a dresser
description:
Of course nothing in here is stolen. Only a careless, shameful, idiotic fetcher would do something as stupid as to buy pilfered goods....
Oh by Azura, I've made a terrible mistake. I bought a gold ring, and Viola Giordano has been missing a ring that looks just like it.
Could you return the ring to her? It's not that easy. She'd go to the guard if she knew I was even remotely involved. You have to get it to her some other way.
Look, it's dangerous, but if you sneak the ring into her house. Put it in a dresser or something. I will make it worth your while.

plots: this is Nazir's final, most challenging assassination contract
Safia's crew is loyal and bloodthirsty
title: Painting the Seas Red
objective: assassinate Safia
description:
I have an assassination contract for you: Safia, a pirate captain. She can be found aboard her ship, the Red Wave. It's currently docked at the Solitude docks.
Safia is a ruthless she-devil, by all accounts. Deadly with a blade. And let's not forget her crew - loyal and bloodthirsty, the lot of them.
This is my final contract, and certainly the most challenging. Be careful with this one, my friend. If you are capable of pulling through this, you've not only earned your payment, but my respect as well. And believe me, friend - that does not come easily.

plots: NONE
title: Stealing Plans
objective: steal the plans of the Silver Hand
tasks: sneak into a Silver Hand camp
description:
I've caught wind that one of the brighter Silver Hand has been sniffing around Eastmarch.
If you can sneak into the Silver Hand camp and steal their plans, we'll have the advantage. Hopefully the plans will let us know more about their movement.

plots: the High King always wore the Jagged Crown: the Jagged Crown is said to contain a portion of the power of every king who has worn it
title: The Jagged Crown
objective: find the Jagged Crown for Ulfric
tasks: meet Galmar Stone-Fist and your fellow Stormcloaks
description:
I've found the final resting place of the Jagged Crown. Can you believe it? Well, I'm almost certain.
The High King always wore the Jagged Crown. It was the symbol of his might and power. The crown is made from the bones and teeth of ancient dragons, and it is said to contain a portion of the power of every king who has worn it. True or not, who would dare deny Ulfric's claim, when the legendary Jagged Crown sits upon his brow?
We're headed to Korvanjund. But, if old King Borgas is indeed buried there, we're bound to run into trouble of some kind. Your fellow Stormcloaks are already assembling outside the tomb. I'll meet you there as soon as I'm finished up here.

plots: Talos worship is outlawed in the Empire: when they buried Torygg, Elisif the Fair made offerings to all the gods except Talos
title: Elisif's Tribute
objective: help Elisif the Fair make the offering to Talos to complete her husband's burial
tasks: take Torygg's war horn to the shrine
description:
There's something... personal... I was hoping you would do for me.
As you may know Talos worship is outlawed in the Empire. When we buried my husband I made offerings to all the gods... except Talos. My husband Torygg would want a proper burial.
I would like you to take an item of his, a war horn handed down from his father, and place it at a Shrine of Talos.
It would mean a lot to me.

plots: Gulum-Ei acted as a go-between for the sale of Goldenglow Estate: he can finger the buyer
the player should talk to Brynjolf before they leave if they have any questions
title: Scoundrel's Folly
objective: squeeze Gulum-Ei for information
description:
Ah, there you are. I have a job for you.
Gulum-Ei is our inside man at the East Empire Company in Solitude. I'm betting he acted as a go-between for the sale of Goldenglow Estate and that he can finger our buyer.
Get out there, shake him down and see what you come up with. Talk to Brynjolf before you leave if you have any questions.

plots: NONE
title: Alchemist in Making
objective: use an alchemy lab to mix a couple of ingredients together
tasks: mix Wheat and Blisterwort together to make a healing potion
description:
You know how to use an alchemy lab right? Mix a couple of ingredients together, see what happens.
A little Wheat and Blisterwort makes a healing potion, if you didn't know. There's plenty of ingredients for sale, too.

BG181: on route from Amn to Baldur's Gate
BG183: on route from Amn to Baldur's Gate
BG184: on route from Amn to Baldur's Gate

plots: NONE
title: Kagain's Quest
objective: kill the bandits that raided the caravan under Kagain's protection
description:
Greetings, I'm Kagain.
I hire mercenaries to escort caravans on route from Amn to Baldur's Gate. Right now I'm lookin' for some strong sword arms, and I'm willing to pay high. It seems that one of the caravans under my protection never arrived at Baldur's Gate, and I need to know what happened. I've been having a lot of problems with bandit activity lately, but they've always only taken the cargo and let the caravan go afterward.
I'll pay each of you 30 gold per dead bandit, plus a share of any booty, if there's no one left alive to claim it.

TESS905: the top of the Hall of Attainment
TESS907: the top of the Hall of Attainment

plots: the player has advanced quickly in their conjuration studies
Phinis Gestor will teach the player the spell to summon the Dremora, but it will only work in a place properly prepared for the event
title: Your Will Be Done
objective: learn powerful, new conjuration spells
tasks: summon an unbound Dremora, prove that you are in control, and order the Dremora bring you a sigil stone from an Oblivion gate
description:
How quickly you've advanced. Most impressive. There are spells yet to be learned, powerful spells that can more closely and more permanently bind creatures to your will. These spells are difficult, even for one as skilled as I. To even begin to inscribe them, I need something very special. A sigil stone from an Oblivion gate.
I do not have one in my possession. Nor do you, I'm sure. So we require a Dremora to retrieve one for us. You will summon one, and order it to bring a sigil stone to you. I will then inscribe the spells for you.
But there are risks. There are always risks. You must summon and command an unbound Dremora. Summoning an Unbound Dremora is not like other Conjuration spells. It will not simply do your bidding. You must first prove you are in control.
I will teach you the spell to summon the Dremora, but know that it will only work in a place properly prepared for the event. Here is the spell you need. Go to the top of the Hall of Attainment; I have prepared a place for you there.

plots: NONE
title: Kill the Vampire
objective: take care of a vampire problem
description:
I'm busy, and I don't like being bothered unless I'm expecting something from you. Oh, don't give me that look. Fine. I supposed I can find some menial task to set your mind on.
Hmm.... We have something of a vampire problem. Bodies have been found with blood drained. I know of a den nearby you can wipe out as a precaution. Pinemoon Cave. I don't expect you to be capable of even that. Vampires are clever hunters. More clever than you, definitely.
I suppose I could show you a little about Illusion magic for free, couldn't I?

TESO380: outside Glarthir's house in Skingrad at 6 am
TESO379: outside Glarthir's house in Skingrad at 6 am

plots: the player came to meet with Glarthir
Glarthir thinks that everyone in Skingrad is watching him
the player should not contact Glarthir in public
title: Paranoia
objective: check out some people for Glarthir
tasks: see where Bernadette Peneles goes and what she does
description:
Ah, you came. You're sure you weren't followed? Good, I thought I could trust you. Nobody else in town.
They're all in on it ... all watching me. Well. Yes. I need you to do something for me. I'll pay you -- gold. You like gold, don't you? Lots of gold.
Here's my problem. I'm being followed. Watched. Marukhati Selectives, maybe. Not sure. I'm a threat, you see? To their plans. I know too much. I need you to check out some people for me, the ones that are following me. Watch them, see where they go, who they report to. Will you help me?
Today I caught Bernadette Peneles watching me. I have very little doubt now that she is one of them. This saddens me. I had thought her one of the few to show me kindness in this nest of treachery. But now it seems that it was all a lie.
Be outside my house at 6 am, you'll see her watching me. See where she goes and who she reports to. We'll meet here again tomorrow night. Oh, and NEVER contact me in public. They're watching. They can't know you're helping me.

plots: the player asked Bralsa Andaren to teach the player Destruction spells
title: Destruction Training
objective: bring 20 bear pelts to Bralsa Andaren to prove that you have helped tear nature asunder
description:
You seek training? If I were to aid you, you would first have to assist me.
I would strip the Creators of their works... you will help with this. Bring me 20 bear pelts, as proof that you have helped tear nature asunder.
Then we shall speak of spells and teaching.

TESS274: hight up the slopes of the Throat of the World

plots: the player killed a dragon for Balgruuf the Greater and absorbed some kind of power from it
the Greybeards think that the player is a Dragonborn: a Dragonborn is said to be uniquely gifted in the voice - the ability to focus the player's vital essence into a Thu'um, or shout
title: The Way of the Voice
objective: answer the summons of the Greybeards
description:
So when the dragon died, you absorbed some kind of power from it. So it's true. The Greybeards really were summoning you. They are masters of the Way of the Voice. They live in seclusion high on the slopes of the Throat of the World.
Whatever happened when you killed that dragon, it revealed something in you, and the Greybeards heard it. If they think you're Dragonborn, who are we to argue?
The Dragonborn is said to be uniquely gifted in the Voice - the ability to focus your vital essence into a Thu'um, or Shout. If you really are Dragonborn, they can teach you how to use your gift.
You'd better get up to High Hrothgar immediately. There's no refusing the summons of the Greybeards. It's a tremendous honor.

plots: Neloth gives the player a ring: it will light up the source of the ash spawn attacks when the player gets close to it
title: Old Friends
objective: find the person who summoned ash spawns and made them attack Neloth
tasks: wear the ring Neloth gave you to find the source of the ash spawns
description:
I'm under attack. There are too many coincidences. There must be someone behind all of my recent troubles.
I have enemies. Legions of them back in Morrowind. However, in this case I have reason to believe it is someone in Solstheim. First I need to identify the culprit. I've enchanted this ring to find the source of the attacks. Here, take it.
Just wear the ring I gave you. It will light up the source when you get close to it. I enchanted the ring with a bit of ash from the last ash spawn attack. It can follow the magical link back to its summoner.

plots: the player asked Ondolemar what he is doing in Markarth
Ondolemar knows that Ogmund the Skald worships Talos in his home: the Jarl of Markarth refuses to arrest Ogmund the Skald
title: Search and Seizure
objective: find evidence of Ogmund the Skald's Talos worship for Ondolemar
tasks: break into Ogmund the Skald's home
description:
I was sent here to lead the Thalmor's interests in this corner of the world. It's my mission to root out all Talos worship in this city.
You're awfully inquisitive, aren't you? I like that. Perhaps you'd care to solve a little problem I'm having? Ogmund the Skald. He's old, respected, and I know for a fact that he worships Talos in his home. But the Jarl has been hesitant to call for his arrest. I want you to break in to his home and find evidence.

plots: the player told Alvor that there was a dragon in Helgen
title: Before the Storm
objective: inform Balgruuf about the dragon in Helgen
description:
What? A dragon? In Helgen? That explains what I saw earlier... a dragon flying down from the south... I was hoping I was wrong about what I thought it was... Didn't want to believe my own eyes, is all.
The Jarl needs to know if there's a dragon on the loose. Riverwood is defenseless... We need to get word to Jarl Balgruuf in Whiterun to send whatever soldiers he can. If you'll do that for me, I'll be in your debt.

plots: the corrupt watchman took Ruslan's last septim
Luronk and Ruslan were shopping at Jensine's when the corrupt watchman accused them of stealing: the corrupt watchman fined Luronk and Ruslan even though Jensine said that they were innocent
the corrupt watchman has shaken down most of the shopkeepers in the Market District
title: Imperial Corruption
objective: do something about the corrupt watchman
tasks: ask around about the corrupt watchman
description:
Hey stranger, can you spare a few coins? I've just been shaken down by that bastard watchman and he took my last septim. I don't know his name, but I'd recognize him if I saw him again.
Luronk and I were shopping at Jensine's when he accused us of stealing. Even Jensine said we were innocent, but he didn't care. We had to pay his "fine" or go to jail.
He's shaken down most of the shopkeepers in the Market District. They're all too afraid of him to do anything. Jensine wouldn't even talk about it.
Someone ought to do something about him.

plots: NONE
title: Hunt and Gather
objective: retrieve Wylandriah's Dwemer Spoon, Orichalcum Ingot, and Grand Soul Gem
description:
I could use some help with getting organized. An assistant perhaps? No, no, no. Maybe a familiar. No, too messy. Well, at any rate, organization is not my strong suit. Not at all. I need as much help as I can get.
In fact, if you could retrieve a few things for me, I could start on my next set of experiments. What I need is my Dwemer Spoon, my Orichalcum Ingot and my Grand Soul Gem. In fact, I could use them immediately.
Well... why are you still standing here? Oh, right. You need to know where they are! That would help. Let's see. Last time I used the Dwemer Spoon was at my dear friend Boti's house in Ivarstead... Fellstar Farm I believe it's called. The Orichalcum Ingot should still be in Winterhold at the Frozen Hearth Inn. I don't know why I didn't just take it with me. And last is the gem. I left that one in Windhelm at the White Phial alchemy shop. It was a good trade too. Ah well.
Bring those items back to me and I'll be happy to experiment on you. No, no... that isn't right. I'd be happy to reward you.

TESO182: the sewage near the back of Bernice's inn, in Crucible
TESO184: the sewage near the back of Bernice's inn, in Crucible
TESO185: the sewage near the back of Bernice's inn, in Crucible

plots: Unknown is dying
Unknown is a drunk
the house of Unknown was stolen by Brithaur
Unknown thinks that Bernice, Caldana, Earil, and Cutter are plotting against him
title: The Paranoid Roof Watcher
objective: find the hidden stash of Unknown
description:
Faded Note
The last thoughts of one of Crucible's residents

I don't think I'll live much longer. My wine supply is thinning, only one bottle left. Bernice's wine is worthless! I would have lasted longer on bark. I'd go back home to resupply, but Brithaur, that maggot, has stolen my house. It's not just him, though, it's also the others. I can't leave the safety of the roof. They have a plan for me, I see it in their eyes. Caldana, Earil, Cutter, ALL OF THEM!
They don't know I'm up here, watching. Not much longer, though. At least they won't find me or my stash. I've put all my favorite things in an urn, and sunken it in the sewage near the back of Bernice's dive.
I think I'll drink that last bottle to celebrate.

BG1310: a set of caves to the northeast
BG1311: a set of caves to the northeast

plots: goblins first appeared around the house of an old mage
the old mage was captured by goblins
title: Magreb and Rilsa
objective: avenge Rilsa and give her a proper burial
description:
Goblins! All I know is they killed Rilsa when she tried to talk to them, and I can't face them by myself. At first they appeared around the house of an old mage, but soon they moved into a set of caves to the northeast, taking him with them.
Forgive me. My name is Magreb. Rilsa and I have watched over this area for years, and we never had any trouble with goblins before. Since they killed her, I've been half out of my mind with grief.
Please avenge my Rilsa and give her a proper burial!

plots: NONE
title: Lost Relic
objective: retrieve the Dawnguard Shield for yourself
tasks: kill the Falmer preventing you from getting the Dawnguard Shield
description:
I've been pouring over some of the tomes left here in the keep. Interesting stories, indeed. Seems the previous incarnation of the Dawnguard had, at one time, some interesting toys.
I have located one of their toys. Arkay and I think it could be a great advantage for us. You should look into retrieving it. It is a magical shield that when blocked with, surrounds its wielder with a holy aura that harms the undead. Might come in handy.
You'll be up against the Falmer of Sightless Pit, if I understand Arkay correctly. Nothing you can't handle.

plots: NONE
title: In My Time of Need
objective: help Alik'r Warriors locate Saadia
tasks: bring information about Saadia to the Alik'r Warriors
description:
You there. We are looking for someone in Whiterun, and will pay good money for information.
We're looking for a fugitive who comes from Hammerfell. A woman -- a foreigner in these lands. Redguard, like us. She is likely not using her true name. She may be somewhere in this city. We will pay for any information regarding her location. We are not welcome here in Whiterun, so we will be in Rorikstead if you learn anything.
Our reasons are none of your concern. All you need to know is that we're paying for information. If that doesn't interest you, feel free to walk away.

BG2148: Officer Roenall's home, northwest of the main government building in the Government District
BG2149: Officer Roenall's home, northwest of the main government building in the Government District
BG2150: Officer Roenall's home, northwest of the main government building in the Government District

plots: Khellor Ahmson saw Officer Roenall using his authority against the player in a corrupt manner
any complaints about Officer Roenall must first go through him: guards cannot do anything about Officer Roenall
Officer Roenall's personal records may reveal his fondness for gems
title: Officer Roenall's Corrupt Actions
objective: bring the evidence of Officer Roenall's corrupt actions to Corgeig Axehand
description:
I am Khellor Ahmson, a mere guard.
I saw what happened, and I share your helplessness. Any complaints about Officer Roenall must first go THROUGH him, so you can imagine how many get through.
This did not come from me, for if my indiscretion against Roenall were to get out, I should be thrown from the military. There is one way you can get to him.
Roenall is quite corrupt and more than willing to exercise his power. You are not monitored as we, so you can do something that I or another guard cannot.
Look to the docks and a man named Barg. Examine him and what he does, and you are sure to see what I mean. You might also wish to pry into Roenall's personal records. They may reveal something of his fondness for gems. I did not tell you this... and I certainly did not say his records are in his home northwest of the main government building in the Government District.
Think on what I've said, and bring anything you learn to Corgeig Axehand in the Government District main building. He is Roenall's commander.

plots: the player is a member of the Dark Brotherhood
Titus Mede II will be surrounded by elite bodyguards, but they might be more lax than usual because everyone assumes that the Dark Brotherhood has been destroyed
title: Hail Sithis!
objective: assassinate Titus Mede II
description:
The Emperor is still in Skyrim, but not for long. He's onboard his ship, the Katariah, moored offshore in the Solitude inlet. But you must hurry!
If you can get onboard that ship. Kill Titus Mede II, as contracted... I will reveal the location of the dead drop that holds your payment.
This is the true Emperor, not some half-penny lookalike. He'll be surrounded by elite bodyguards, I'm sure. You'll have your work cut out for you. Still... everyone assumes the Dark Brotherhood has been completely destroyed. They may be a bit more lax than usual.

plots: the player told Robot Eye that the player wants to go through the door
title: Enter the Door
objective: recover the Crown from Thiss, and bring it to Robot Eye
description:
You want through THIS door? Ha! Well, it's not as simple as that. Everything has a price - you must know that by now.
If you can solve a problem for us, we will solve a problem for you by letting you through the door. Thiss, the great Spectral Dragon, has kept something of ours for many long years. We would like it back - and you will get it for us, oh yes.
There is a Crown, a... family heirloom that he stole from us. He will not give it up easily, of course. But this door is im-PENETRABLE - so you've got a much better chance with Thiss than you do waiting around here.
You can find Thiss in the Forgotten Halls... good luck! You're going to need it.

BG1200: the art collector's estate, west of the fairgrounds, in the center of Baldur's Gate

plots: mercenaries were petrified while trying to break into the home of Ramazith: Ramazith sold the mercenaries to an art collector
Degrodel gives the player six scrolls of stone to flesh to unpetrify the mercenaries
one of the mercenaries has the Helm of Balduran
title: Searching for Balduran's Helmet
objective: bring the Helm of Balduran to Degrodel
description:
First of all, my name is Degrodel. I have been on the lookout for skilled adventurers. My task is very simple.
Some years ago, an evil band of mercenaries were all petrified while trying to break into the home of Ramazith. For those of you with a limited vocabulary, petrified means "turned to stone." Anyhow, one of those adventurers had in his possession an item of power: the Helm of Balduran. Ramazith didn't know this at the time and so, after turning them all to stone, he simply sold their bodies to an art collector living in the heart of Baldur's Gate.
What I would like you to do is find these statues, turn them back to flesh, and take the item. I will give you these six scrolls of stone to flesh. Use them on the statues when you find them.
The estate can be found just west of the fairgrounds in the center of town. Good luck, and don't entertain any thoughts about betraying me. It could be very hazardous to your health.
You will be paid 5,000 gold for this service. This is a kingly sum, so I won't barter with you about the amount.

plots: Lithnilian is the first to discover Welkynd Stones growing in a natural cave
title: No Stone Unturned
objective: help Lithnilian recover his research notes
description:
Ten years of research down the drain!
I've been studying the Welkynd Stones. Yes, the aquamarine colored crystals usually native to Ayleid ruins. It seems I'm the first to discover them growing in a natural cave. That's about all I can say about it.
I don't suppose I could convince you to help me recover my research notes? I was doing some research in Bramblepoint Cave, and suddenly I was attacked. I grabbed everything I could and ran, but I fear I dropped my notes. Those notes are very important to me and represent ten years of my life. If you could recover them, I'd be sure to reward you appropriately with some potent potions.

plots: NONE
title: The Hunt
objective: send a message to the Dawnguard by killing one of them without drawing attention
description:
You're going to go kill a Dawnguard spy.
But don't draw attention. Some kills are for fun, some for profit. And others are for sending messages. This one is a message. Don't make a big scene. Don't get caught.
The corpse is to be the message, not the attack. With any luck he'll bleed to death before anyone notices. A cold corpse will say what we want better than a warm one.

plots: Dao genies came to Trademeet
Dao genies are hunting Ihtafeer
Dao genies won't allow trade to occur in Trademeet until Ihtafeer's head is delivered to them
title: Dealing with the Trademeet Genies
objective: investigate the issue with the Dao genies
tasks: talk with Guildmistress Busya about what needs to be done
description:
My name is Lord Logan Coprith, and I am the High Merchant of Trademeet.
A group of Dao genies from Calimshan arrived to Trademeet a while ago. They and their gold were welcome enough at first... But in only weeks, they have taken all business and put a stop to it. They are hunting a rakshasa named Ihtafeer and insist that she is present in the town.
The genies will allow no trade to occur until Ihtafeer is found and her head given to them. Why... why they have chosen this particular tactic, I am unsure.
Without proper trade, however, the merchants are penniless. Soon, the food resources will dry up as well, so something must be done... and done soon.
Perhaps you might be able to look into this genie issue for us? Guildmistress Busya in the next room can tell you more about what needs to be done.

plots: NONE
title: Ghosts of Plunder Cove
objective: avenge Olwin
tasks: find the hidden refuge of Captain Willy, and kill him
description:
I mean you no harm; I am but a lonely soul, trapped in the afterlife. Betrayed and drowned by villainous companions, I dwell here, reliving my end, waiting in vain for my death to be avenged.
But it has been over a hundred years since I took my last breath, and nearly that many since my murderers themselves perished, in their hidden retreat in Plunder Cove. Seek their leader, Captain Willy. Show him that justice has neither forgotten him... nor forgiven him!

plots: the last tenant of Arborwatch has cleaned the place of furniture
Seed-Neeus should have furniture for sale
title: Buying a house in Chorrol
objective: purchase Arborwatch
description:
It is a pleasure to meet you. I am Countess Valga of Chorrol.
Are you looking for a house to buy? There is a positively gorgeous home for sale right on the main plaza. You'll be hard pressed to find a nicer home for sale in Chorrol.
The house is called Arborwatch, and it costs 20,000 gold to buy the house from me. It would be a pleasure to have you become a citizen of Chorrol.
The last tenant of Arborwatch has cleaned the place of furniture. I'd recommend stopping by Northern Goods and Trade. The owner, Seed-Neeus, should have everything you need.

TESS958: Azura's shrine, up the steps to the altar
TESS959: Azura's shrine, up the steps to the altar

plots: Azura has given Aranea Ienith the gift of foresight
title: The Black Star
objective: become the champion of Azura
tasks: ask around about an elven mage who can turn the brightest star as black as night
description:
Azura has seen your coming, traveler. It was not curiosity, but fate, that has led you here.
Azura has given me the gift of foresight. I had a vision of you walking up the steps to this altar long before you were born. You have been chosen to be her champion. I know it is unexpected, but do not worry. It will all unfold as she has predicted.
You must go to a fortress, endangered by water, yet untouched by it. Inside, you will find an elven mage who can turn the brightest star as black as night. It is cryptic, I know, but Azura's signs are never wrong. I believe the fortress may refer to Winterhold. Ask if they know this elven enchanter.

plots: the player is a Shadowmaster of the Shadow Thieves
Sir Greshal has been trying to muscle into a relationship with the Shadow Thieves
Sir Greshal wishes to be introduced to a Shadow Thieves' contact here in the city: that contact will be the player
Ama will dispense a runner to get Sir Greshal after the player meets her
title: Government Relations
objective: help Ama kill Sir Greshal
description:
My name is Ama, and I am Shadowmaster of Eastern Esmeltaran.
I would like you to participate in a little rendezvous and help in the removal of a pest. There is a government official, Sir Greshal, causing us no end of trouble with his tariffs and spot checks on caravans. This fool thinks he can stifle the thieving trade of an entire city. He has been trying to muscle into a relationship with the Shadow Thieves, and while we could pay, it is better that we send a message to any of his cohorts. I have come here with a promise of granting his wishes, but I only want to lure him away from his palisade defenses. This is where you come in.
Sir Greshal wishes to be introduced to a contact here in the city, and that contact will be you. The meeting is already set up, and when he arrives, we will take him by surprise. You are known somewhat in this place, if not as a guildmaster. He will believe you are a legitimate contact. He seems willing to believe anything, so long as it is theatrical.
It will be any evening that is best for you. I will await you in Waukeen's Promenade after dark and then dispense a runner to get Sir Greshal. The suddenness will seem dramatic to him.

plots: NONE
title: Cacklespit's Brew
objective: collect ingredients for Cacklespit's brew
tasks: get Mask of a Murderer, Thorns as Hard as Iron, and Black Heart of a Coward
description:
Another customer for one of old Cacklespit's brews, eh? I can provide a special concoction, free of charge...if you aren't afraid to get your hands a little dirty.
As any true cook will tell you, the finest ingredients are of the utmost importance if you want to create something truly special. I will require three items to brew the special mixture I have in mind...
The Mask of a Murderer, Thorns as Hard as Iron, and the Black Heart of a Coward.
All three are to be found here in the bogs - you only have to find them!
Once I brew the ingredients properly, your name will be known for generations to come!

plots: after saving the temple priests, the player can focus on aiding the Guardian of the Wild
title: Sudden Outbreaks
objective: save uninfected temple priests from Nether-Thralls
description:
Thank the Gods you are here! A plague is sweeping through the Watchweald Temple, transforming the temple priests into Nether-Thralls! Several uninfected priests are still inside, trapped by the Nether-Thralls. I can protect them, if I can reach them... or if they can reach me.
Look for places where the temple priests may have hidden from the Nether-Thralls, and send them back here. Once they are all safe, we can focus on aiding the Guardian of the Wild.

plots: the rings of blood magic increase the abilities of the player's vampiric powers: Molag Bal supposedly gave the rings to vampires
title: Rings of Blood Magic
objective: retrieve a set of ancient rings of blood magic for yourself
tasks: retrieve the Ring of the Erudite
retrieve the Ring of the Beast
description:
I've discovered the whereabouts of a set of ancient rings of Blood Magic: the Ring of the Erudite in Swindler's Den and the Ring of the Beast in Cragwallow Slope. They belong among our kind, not gathering mold in some vagabond's treasure pile.
The rings increase the abilities of your vampiric powers. Some say Molag Bal himself gave these rings to ancient powerful vampire lords. Some say that is just a myth.
You'll be able to keep the rings. I wouldn't be telling you where to find them if I desired them for myself.

plots: Coran and Safana were traveling Forest of Tethir: Safana was kidnapped by wolfweres
Coran managed to escape from wolfweres
Coran will go with the player: Coran will help the player save Safana
title: Coran and the Wolfweres
objective: save Safana from wolfweres
description:
Hail, good friend! I am most pleased to see you here! Your timing could not be better, as I, Coran, am in most dire need!
I was traveling Forest of Tethir with my beloved Safana... and now she is kidnapped! It is dreadful! Two days ago, we were beset by giant wolves... wolfweres, I fear. They tried to take us both, but I was able to escape. Safana, however, was not so fortunate. I tracked them to an encampment east of here, but even a great warrior such as myself cannot beat them alone.
We must save her and strike a blow against the foul werebeasts! Together, we shall be unstoppable!

plots: "Dead Drop Orders #4" has been addressed to the player: the player is a Silencer of the Dark Brotherhood
the player killed J'Ghasta for Lucien Lachance before
Shaleez was banished from her home village near Black Marsh/Morrowind border for a murder of a Dark Elven family: the Morag Tong can't reach Shaleez
title: Final Justice
objective: assassinate Shaleez
description:
Dead Drop Orders #4
by Lucien Lachance

J'Ghasta is dead! Well done! I was right about you, Silencer. You are a useful tool indeed. Let's see if you can continue to impress me.
You must journey now to the Flooded Mine. There you will find Shaleez, an Argonian hunter who was banished from her village near the Black Marsh/Morrowind border for the brutal murder of a Dark Elven family. Relatives of the murdered family members have located Shaleez, and demand retribution. And, since the assignment is a bit far for Morrowind's Morag Tong to handle, the Dark Brotherhood has been commissioned to perform the elimination.
Be warned, Silencer! Shaleez is a skilled and deadly hunter, and will fight like the desperate fugitive she is.
After Shaleez has been eliminated, your reward and another contract will be waiting at the dead drop located in a coffin, just outside the ruins of Fort Redman.

plots: Sir Ryan Trawl has heard of the player
Anarg was implicated in smuggling slaves: he was expelled from the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
Anarg took some young knights of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart with him
if the player considers the Fallen Paladins a threat, they are free to do what they consider necessary
title: Investigate the Fallen Paladins
objective: investigate the Fallen Paladins
description:
Greetings, traveler. I am Sir Ryan Trawl. I have heard of you. I would like to offer you the opportunity to help the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart.
The task of being a paladin is not easy. Many break under the demands of our path and leave to pursue avenues of life more appropriate to their talents. Sometimes they bend instead of break, twisting their paladinhood to serve their own purpose. These are hard to detect, but when found, they are quickly cast out.
Recently, one of our highest-ranking officers was implicated in smuggling slaves. His name is Anarg, and though he was once a friend, he was expelled from the Order. We thought that the end of it, but Anarg took others when he left. He is a charismatic man, and some of the younger knights were swayed by his words. We could tolerate their loss, but they masquerade as paladins, abusing our good name. They extort, smuggle slaves, and spit on all that we honor. The Fallen Paladins, as they're known, would recognize any of our Order, and some also fear conflict with former friends, so we need outside help in this matter.
The Fallen Paladins always need warriors to aid their illegal activities. We want you to ally with them, especially Anarg. He's the key to them all. If you consider these men a threat, then do what you think is necessary. Gloves of Healing would be a suitable reward for the task, I think.
Anarg has kept their activities localized in the Bridge District. I suggest you search there. May Torm be with you.

plots: Stormherald Nallabir lost this past tenday's theological debate to a a representative of the Lathanderian temple in the Government District
the temple of Talos hired Travin to steal a Dawn Ring from the Lathanderian temple
title: Another Mission for the Temple of Talos
objective: get the Dawn Ring from Travin and bring it to Talon Yarryl
description:
It's Talon Yarryl, priest of Talos.
I have a chore for you that may prove interesting.
This is not a matter of negotiation or exploration. No, now you are to face true enemies of Talos.
Slanderous words have been said. Things did not go well for Stormherald Nallabir at this past tenday's theological debate in the Government District. The growing arrogance of the Lathanderian church is distasteful. Talos should be feared; their irreverence is insulting.
We have hired a thief, and he has stolen a Dawn Ring from the Lathanderian temple.
Find Travin in the slums at night, collect the ring, and return it here.
Remember that the honor of Talos rests upon your shoulders.

plots: the College of Winterhold has gone to great lengths to purify and enhance the natural energies of the world
title: Out of Balance
objective: remove pollution from the various points of focus for magic energies with specially enchanted gloves, and return the gloves to Drevis Neloren afterwards
tasks: find the focus points for magical energy
description:
There may be a matter in which your... skills... could be useful. The various points of focus for magic energies around the College have become polluted, and need cleansing.
As you may be aware, the College has gone to great lengths to purify and enhance the natural energies of the world. This both enhances our connection to the realm of magic, and eliminates possible interference from outside sources. These energies, on occasion, become... polluted. Effort must be made to see that they are kept pure, clean.
These specially enchanted gloves will allow you to delve directly into the focal points for these energies. Go to each focal point and remove whatever impurities you may find there. Return the gloves to me when you have finished. Please exercise caution. This is not a procedure without possible... consequences.

plots: Reynald Jemane has never been to Cheydinhal
title: Separated at Birth
objective: investigate the rumors about another Reynald Jemane in Cheydinhal
tasks: find the person whose impersonating Reynald Jemane and tell him to stop
description:
If I've told you once, I've told you a thousand times. I've NEVER been to Cheydinhal! I... oh, hang on. You're someone else. Apologies, my good friend, I mistook you for someone else. Always being asked about it, I am. 'Didn't I see you in Cheydinhal?', they say. Well I'm sick of it. Sick and tired, tired and sick. And perhaps a little drunk. But never mind. You look like the honest sort, so I've a job for you.
You're going to travel to Cheydinhal, and find out what sort of impostor is trying to besmirch my good name. And you're going to tell him... *hic*... You're going to tell him I am quite capable of besmirching my good name on my own. He should cease and desist immediately. There's fifty gold pieces in it for you, friend...

plots: the player has trespassed gnolls' territory with the player's party
the gnolls' demand 50 gold from the player, but the player doesn't have any money
title: Ludrug's Band
objective: win the duel against Ludrug
tasks: choose your champion to fight against Ludrug
description:
Stop! You have trespassed on our territory. You shall not be allowed to leave until you have paid tribute. We demand 50 gold in tribute!
No money? That is too bad for you. We let you go only if you win fight. Your best champion versus our best champion. Our best champion is Ludrug. Ludrug is me. Are you ready for fight? No matter, we fight now!
If you lose, you must die! If you win, we must let you pass! Tread carefully, we will be watching you.

plots: the player successfully completed their previous tasks to Fazeer Shah: this is the player's final task
Ezrek Khan draws his power from the same source as the Netherim: the Netherim will oppose the player should they challenge Ezrek Khan
title: The Djinni's Final Task
objective: free the Guardian by humiliating Ezrek Khan
tasks: steal Ezrek Khan's Lamp of Marvels
description:
Well, well. You are much more determined... and capable... than I had suspected! Excellent...
Now, to your final task. If you truly wish to free the Guardian, you must humiliate my old rival, Ezrek Khan, by stealing his precious Lamp of Marvels.
Be warned: Ezrek Khan draws his power from the same source as the Netherim. His realm borders closely on theirs; they will almost certainly stand against you, should you challenge the djinni.

plots: NONE
title: A Book for Firebead
objective: bring "The History of the Fateful Coin" to Firebead Elvenhair
tasks: find "The History of the Fateful Coin"
description:
Hello, I am Firebead Elvenhair: an elderly mage and a bookworm.
Oh, the world of books... I have heard that a new copy of that wondrous tome, "The History of the Fateful Coin," can be had for a pretty penny in one of the stores around here. If you would be so kind as to buy it for an old man like myself, I'd gladly reimburse you.
I'd even give you a little bonus to help in your travels, a book called "History of the Dead Three".

plots: NONE
title: Ore Identification
objective: pick up an ore sample for Hafjorg for identification
tasks: speak to Filnjar to get the ore sample
description:
I swear, if I wasn't around, Elgrim would forget to eat his meals. How we make any coin at all is beyond me.
In fact, I need to arrange for someone to pick up an ore sample for me in Shor's Stone... goodness knows Elgrim won't lift a finger to do it.
You would do this for me? Oh, that would be wonderful. Speak to Filnjar in Shor's Stone. He's got some sort of ore sample he wants us to identify and was willing to pay us well for it.
The job pays well, so I hope I can make arrangements soon. We could really use the gold. I'll have Elgrim make some potions for you for all that travel.

plots: NONE
title: Bassilus the Murderer
objective: kill Bassilus and bring his holy symbol to Kelddath Ormlyr
description:
A warning from Kelddath Ormlyr:
know that there is a madman by the name of Bassilus who roams the wilderness killing any innocents that happen along his path. He's been last sighted in Red Canyons.
If you were to dispose of him and bring back his holy symbol, there is a large reward offered. It is a grisly task, but sometimes there is little choice.

plots: NONE
title: Lost Glory
objective: retrieve the Helm of Winterhold for Korir
description:
Winterhold has lost much of its history, and with that much of its power. I, Korir, the Jarl of Winterhold, aim to change that.
I've heard rumors of the resting place of the Helm of Winterhold, the very same helm that Hanse wore in the First Era. He was in line to be High King of Skyrim, you know. Having that might get the ear of the other nobles and give me some authority.
The Helm of Winterhold lies in Hob's Fall Cave. Recover it, and I'll You have Winterhold's thanks.

plots: the Silver Hand attacked the Companions in Jorrvaskr, killed Kodlak, and stole the fragments of Wuuthrad
title: Purity of Revenge
objective: avenge Kodlak
tasks: retrieve the fragments of Wuuthrad and wipe out the Silver Hand
description:
The Silver Hand attacked us. They finally found enough courage to attack Jorrvaskr. We fought them off, but... The old man... Kodlak... he's dead.
No one else got hurt, but they made off with all our fragments of Wuuthrad. But you and I are going to reclaim them. We will bring the battle to their chief camp, Driftshade Refuge. There will be none left living to tell their stories. Only songs of Jorrvaskr will be sung.
We will avenge Kodlak. And they will know terror before the end.

TESO140: the many military fort ruins scattered all over Cyrodiil
TESO142: the many military fort ruins scattered all over Cyrodiil

plots: NONE
title: A Venerable Vintage
objective: bring the Shadowbanish Wine to Nerussa
description:
Greetings. I'm Nerussa. I'm quite fond of collecting all manners of wines from all over Tamriel. But one vintage continues to elude me: Shadowbanish Wine. How I'd love to add it to my collection.
Apparently the wine is so rare because it was only made in one tiny batch. It's the product of an alchemist who was also a vintner. Besides tasting incredible, the magic within the wine allows the imbiber to be gifted with Night Eye! The vintner made it special for the Legion soldiers posted at the forts when they were active long ago. It was perfect for keeping lookouts warm on cold nights and helping them see better in the dark.
If you can retrieve six bottles of Shadowbanish Wine, I'll gladly pay you well: 1,000 gold. All I know about them is that they're found in the many fort ruins scattered all over Cyrodiil.

plots: the player has done assassination contracts for Nazir before
title: Deadly Research
objective: assassinate Maluril
description:
I have another assassination contract for you: Maluril. He's dangerous. Very dangerous. A rogue Dark Elf mage doing research into dwarven artifacts should be both respected... and feared. Just not by you.
Maluril is doing his research in Mzinchaleft. A Dwarven ruin... what an exotic place for a kill. I hope the elf doesn't give you too much trouble. I once got set on fire by a sorcerer. Nasty business, that. But I digress.

plots: NONE
title: Payment Delivery
objective: help Pactur alleviate Bryling's wrath about missing shipments
tasks: tell Bryling that there will be a shipment soon
description:
Bryling's already come down hard on us for missing shipments. Likely to do it again, since we're late.
You could take word to her in Solitude that there'll be a shipment soon. Buy us some time and keep her off our backs. In exchange, I'm willing to let a few ingots go missing. Maybe more than a few.
You'd do me quite a favor. I wouldn't forget it. I'm sure she'll be angry. Brace yourself.

plots: the player has caught thieves for Azzan before
the player has met Maglir
title: Den of Thieves
objective: get rid of the gang of thieves that has thieved around Anvil
tasks: track down the gang of thieves with Maglir
description:
Greetings! Looking for some more work, are you?
Good to see you're working hard. I've got some more thieves for you to deal with in Anvil. There have been a number of thefts in the area, and witnesses believe the thieves are holed up nearby. Check around, and see what you can learn. I'm not sure the numbers you'll be dealing with, so I'm sending you with another new recruit. Maglir. I believe you two have already met.
Get moving. You need to get rid of those thieves.

plots: Xedilian would normally have sent the player back to the entrance when they stepped on the pad in the Resonator Chamber: the player mus deal with the adventurers who are entering Xedilian before the player can leave Xedilian
the player should consult Kiliban Nyrandil or the Manual
title: Baiting the Trap
objective: get out of Xedilian
description:
Welcome to Xedilian, I'm the dungeon caretaker, Kiliban Nyrandil.
Xedilian would normally have sent you back to the entrance when you stepped on the pad in the Resonator Chamber. Since you're up here, I can only surmise that adventurers are already entering the dungeon as we speak.
I'm afraid until the adventurers are dealt with, Xedilian will keep you here. Even I can't will its doors to open. To put it bluntly, you're stuck here for the moment. No disrespect intended.
The only thing we can do is let the adventurers complete a cycle through here. I'll be glad to help. I assume Sheogorath gave you the Manual. You can consult it for more information, or I can provide instructions.

plots: Ordrak's Heart wreaking havoc
the Guardian wants the player to go to the Ossean Wastes
title: Return to the Enclave
objective: stop the Alchemist before it's too late
tasks: go to the Ossean Wastes with the help of Commander Vale
description:
I don't know if the Alchemist understands that Ordrak's Heart is wreaking such havoc... or if he just doesn't care! I hope there's still a chance to stop him, one way or another, before it's too late.
So the Guardian wants you to head to the Ossean Wastes? You know what? I think I can help you with that...

BG283: Tiris and Jenia's home, north of the Alibakkar estate

plots: Tiris is too frightened to leave Tiris and Jenia's home
title: Helping Tiris
objective: figure out why Tiris is frightened
description:
My name is Jenia, and I come to you on behalf of my son, Tiris. He is very frightened. Too frightened to even leave our home!
I beg of you to come and speak to him! To see what has frightened him so and perhaps help him!
Tiris is at our home, the one just north of the Alibakkar estate. Please come as soon as you are able to! I so despair seeing him like this! I know I am poor and have nothing to offer, but I beg you to help my son!

plots: Hull knows the player
there is an antidote in Hull's chest: Dreppin needs an antidote for Nessa
title: Hull's Sword
objective: fetch Hull's sword
tasks: find Hull's sword in his chest
description:
Hey, kid, it's me, Hull.
I woke late this morning and left my sword in the barracks before going on duty. If you want to get it for me, it's in the chest at the foot of my bed on the right side of the barracks. Quick now, before the Gatewarden catches me without it.
You'll also find an antidote there. I think Dreppin needs one for old Nessa.
You'll get 20 gold pieces for saving my skin from the Chief.

plots: Sheogorath's citizens need a new ruler when he is gone: the player has to replace a current Duke or Duchess of Madness
Malacath's realm is a nasty place
title: Ritual of Accession
objective: become a ruler in the Court of Madness
description:
Once I am gone, things usually get bad quickly.
You'll need the respect of My citizens. They'll need a leader, someone to look up to when I'm gone. They're the backbone of any great land. Except where the backbone is an actual backbone. Ever been to Malacath's realm...? Nasty stuff. But, back to the business at hand.
You'll need to control one of the Courts of Madness. Replace a current Duke. Or Duchess. Whichever. That will command respect! The people will rally around you. You'll have their love, their admiration, their complaints! Whatever. As long as it keeps them on Our side.
Speak to Arctus and Dervenin, the High Priests at the Sacellum Arden-Sul. They can explain what needs to be done.

plots: the player is married: it presents difficulties for vampires
vampirism is the greatest gift that vampires can bestow to their loved ones
title: The Gift
objective: turn your wife into a vampire
tasks: use vampiric seduction on your wife, embrace her and bite her neck
description:
It's come to my inescapable attention that you, my dear friend, are married. Marriage is a fine institution, however, one that does present certain difficulties for such as like ourselves.
May I strongly suggest that you make a visit to this spouse of yours and "invite" her to the family by offering her the Gift of Vampirism. Put her mind to rest, allay her fear through vampiric seduction and when she is in a pliant condition, embrace her and bite her on the neck.
It is the greatest token we can bestow upon those we love and wish to see protected.

BG195: behind a painting at the Three Old Kegs
BG197: behind a painting at the Three Old Kegs
BG198: behind a painting at the Three Old Kegs

plots: Ghorak was cursed with an illness for killing his brother
Agnasia knows how to cure Ghorak
title: Ghorak the Diseased
objective: take Kereph's skull to Agnasia
description:
For your own health and that of your children, come no closer.
I, Ghorak, was cursed with this fell disease as punishment for my wickedness... No, your potions and magics are of little use. The only way to cure this sickness is to right the wrongs of the past. Behind a painting at the Three Old Kegs, you will find the skull of my brother, Kereph. Take it to Agnasia in The Lady's Hall. She will know what to do with it.

BG258: the storefront in the central docks
BG259: the storefront in the central docks

plots: Renal will give the player papers which say that the player was being transferred by the Shadowmaster
the player is supposed to spy on Mae'Var from the inside
the player will need to reassure Mae'Var
title: Find Proof of Mae'Var's Treachery
objective: find evidence about Mae'Var's planned betrayal
tasks: show the papers to Gorch to gain access to Mae'Var's guild house
description:
My name is Renal, as I'm sure you've been told. Renal "Bloodscalp"... a little nickname I've earned over time. Rather grisly, but it keeps the fearful in line.
One of my guild houses to the south is run by a rather ambitious fellow named Mae'Var. Good thief, but I never liked him. Now I know why. I've had some hints that he is getting too big for himself. Thinking of taking my place, I suspect, but I've had no real evidence to say that this is so.
I will give you papers saying you were being transferred by the Shadowmaster. You will spy on Mae'Var from the inside and find me the evidence that I need. You'll need to reassure Mae'Var, naturally. He won't know who you are, but I am confident that you are more than capable of this.
Just head to the storefront in the central docks area and speak to the storekeeper, Gorch. Show the papers to him, and he'll let you in the guild house proper.
I think you will find the reward adequate. 10,000 gold is no small fortune, though I think you deserve a little more. From my personal armory, a sword.

plots: NONE
title: A Political Murder
objective: assassinate Helvard
description:
You are going on a little vacation in Falkreath. You'll be able to enjoy the sights, sample the food... and kill the housecarl, Helvard.
You know what that means? He's the bodyguard to the Jarl of Falkreath himself. So be careful. That's sure to throw a branch into Falkreath's well-oiled political machine.

plots: Julienne Fanis can tell the player more about Garridan's Tears
title: Tears of the Savior
objective: find as many Garridan's Tears for S'Drassa as possible
description:
S'Drassa of the Mages Guild. Evoker and Alchemist. Could you assist me in acquiring something for my crystal collection?
I'm searching for some specific crystals known as Garridan's Tears. I want you to bring me as many of Garridan's Tears as you can find. If you do, I will pay you a fair bounty in gold for each one. I confess I have a weakness for crystals of a magical nature, and I must add these to my collection. This is a personal errand, you must understand. Just between you and I. The Mages Guild has nothing to do with it.
The Tears are not just a namesake. They're literally the frozen tears of a knight named Garridan Stalrous who lived many years ago. I'm not certain what happened to the knight, or why the tears were frozen, but I do know someone you could ask. Seek out Julienne Fanis at the Arcane University in the Imperial City. She oversees the Alchemy Headquarters there. If anyone can help you get more information on about these crystals, she can.

BG271: along the path to the east of the troll mound

plots: the player is a druid
Nilthiri will overrun the grove if not stopped
title: Heeding the Spirit of the Grove
objective: serve the grove as a leader bringing balance
description:
I am the spirit of the grove, child. I am the water, the earth, the trees, and the sun. I am life and death: the eternal cycle.
A druid who serves the cause of balance is needed. The grove requires leadership, a gentle hand. Will you serve the grove as such? There is much work to be done. Listen and learn the path of balance, the path of the Eternal Cycle.
Long have the trolls of the mound lived beneath the protection of the grove. But a new leader has arisen. Nilthiri the shamaness leads the trolls to chaos. She urges them to expand their territory, and she brings more trolls to the mound without thought to the consequences. If this continues, the trolls will overrun the grove, and nature will suffer. A servant of nature must bring the life cycle of Nilthiri to a close for the good of all.
You will find Nilthiri along the path to the east of the troll mound.

plots: Rallus may know more about the creatures that attacked the Odiil Farm
title: The Killing Field
objective: reclaim the Odiil Farm from the creatures of the Great Forest with Rallus and Antus
tasks: meet up with Rallus and Antus
description:
My sons! Have you seen my sons Rallus and Antus? They're going to fight off the creatures at our farm, but I fear for their safety.
For the last few days, we've suffered attacks from these creatures at our farm not far from Chorrol. They're coming from someplace in the Great Forest. I don't know where, but Rallus may know more by now. My boys will take up the fight even if the guards won't. Doesn't matter if it's outside the town walls - it still affects us all. They expect me to go with them, but... I fear in my old age, I'm not the warrior I once was. Would you... would you go in my place?
I'm supposed to meet them at Weynon Priory. You'd best get whatever supplies you need now, so you can get there in time.
I... I need a drink to calm my nerves. Please, excuse me.

plots: NONE
title: First Lessons
objective: join the College of Winterhold
tasks: cast Mage Light on the seal on the ground
description:
It would seem that the College has what you seek. The question now is what you can offer the College.
