Not just anyone is allowed inside. Those wishing to enter must show some degree of skill with magic. A small test, if you will.
The Mage Light spell is useful to any mage, not just those specializing in Alteration. Can you cast one on the seal on the ground?

plots: Perth warns the player to stay out of Soljund's Sinkhole
title: Soljund's Sinkhole
objective: make Soljund's Sinkhole safe again
description:
Whoa, there. I don't know where you're going, but stay out of that mine. It isn't safe.
We tunneled into an old Nordic crypt. The whole place is crawling with draugr. We're not mining up any ore with those undead around, so I wouldn't go down there if I were you.
You want to clear out the draugr? You're joking, right? Those bone-walkers will tear you limb from limb. But if you want to get yourself killed, go ahead.
I hear talk about a regiment coming to clear the crypt out. We'll see if that happens.

plots: Jaree-Ra and Deeja collect things nobody misses
with the war, many more ships come through Solitude Docks loaded with weapons and pay, but few people
title: Lights Out!
objective: help run the Icerunner aground
description:
It's easy to find things to sell. Things nobody will miss. Things from underground, or just left lying around in someone's house. I bet the two of us, we're very alike. So why not take the next step? We can help each other.
My sister Deeja and I are treasure hunters. You could be too. We like to collect things. We are not thieves. We just take what will not be missed. What no one needs anymore. Maybe we take some weapons and stop a few deaths. Who would call that thievery?
With the war, many more ships come through these docks. Loaded with weapons and pay, but few people. And they pass through dangerous waters. We have an interest in one of those boats, the Icerunner. The Solitude Lighthouse will be guiding it in... but if its fire were to go out, the Icerunner would run aground.
If someone were to put out the lighthouse fire and then meet me on the docks afterwards... I could certainly direct them to that loot. That someone could be you.

plots: magical stone golems are known to be powerful and dangerous
title: Find Mimic's Blood for Jermien the Cowled Wizard
objective: bring Jermien the blood of a mimic so that he can complete his magical stone golem
tasks: find the blood of a mimic
description:
I am none other than Jermien... licensed Cowled Wizard for this region.
I am working on a golem of stone! A fine piece of magical craftsmanship, if I do say so myself! Few other mages have made the attempt, you see. This type of golem is quite powerful and dangerous... but I am more than skilled enough to control it. Once it's complete, I'll have an excellent servant.
Trouble is, I'm missing one of the crucial ingredients... the blood of a mimic. I'd pay handsomely for some, in fact. Hmmm... you look like the adventurous type... care to find me some?
Hmm. I seem to recall that I've got a magical sword around here that I won in a bet from a certain fool. I've no use for it, but it's valuable. Find me some mimic's blood and it's yours.

plots: Modryn Oreyn has been investigating the Blackwood Company: they are a danger to the Fighters Guild
the Fighters Guild was contracted by Argoth to recover an artifact from Azani Blackheart: Modryn Oreyn went in there with twenty good men, and left with five
Vitellus Donton was not one of the survivors: he died while covering the Fighters Guild members' retreat
Argoth is dead and the artifact is gone after the Blackwood Company supposedly finished the contract instead of the Fighters Guild
Vilena Donton is not going to know about this mission: it's the player's choice to accept the mission
title: Azani Blackheart
objective: help Modryn Oreyn prove that the Blackwood Company lied about completing a contract for Argoth
description:
Good. You're here. We've got duties to attend to.
I've been looking into the Blackwood Company. Heard some disturbing things. We know they're a danger to us. And we know they're good at what they do.
I've heard stories, but nothing I can prove is true. Maybe they've got a mage working with them. Maybe they're just well trained. All I know for sure is that they'll accept any contract, and they'll do anything to complete it. And they don't care who gets in the way.
We were contracted by a wizard, Argoth, to recover an artifact from Azani Blackheart, a ruthless bandit leader. I went in there with twenty men. I left with five. Vitellus Donton wasn't one of them. He died covering our retreat. I snooped around. Apparently, the Blackwood Company completed that contract for us. I went in there with twenty good men. I can't believe that bunch finished the job. There's more. Argoth -- he's dead, the artifact gone. Sounds like a set-up. Maybe they made a deal with Blackheart. I don't know. But I'll find out.
Now we find out what really happened. And we let it be known. I want to show the people who the Blackwood Company really are. I can't order you do this with me. It's dangerous, and Vilena Donton isn't going to know about it. It's your choice.
If you accept this mission, we leave as soon as you're ready. I want to investigate Blackheart's stronghold at Arpenia. Meet me at the Leyawiin guild hall. We'll go from there.

plots: vampires are becoming a larger threat
title: Dawnguard
objective: join the Dawnguard
tasks: speak with Isran about joining the Dawnguard
description:
I'm Durak of the Dawnguard.
We are vampire hunters. We search out and destroy those bloodsucking scum wherever we find them. We are looking for anyone willing to fight against the growing vampire menace.
Everybody says that they are not interested about joining, right up until they find their throat being ripped out by a pack of hungry vampires.
Want to sign up to the Dawnguard and kill vampires? Go talk to Isran, our leader, at Fort Dawnguard, southeast of Riften. He'll decide if you're Dawnguard material.

plots: NONE
title: G'axir the Seer
objective: bring a sphene gem to G'axir the Seer
description:
Your future... is hemmed in darkness.
Your lives... are in the balance.
Act wisely, act judiciously... and bring me the sphene gem, should you find it...
You... are a light entering darkness.
You... are a seeker of truths.
You... are more than you realize.
The Seer has spoken it because the Seer knows the fear you harbor, the fear you shall yet become.
In the lair of the basilisk, you will find a sphene gem... You would do well to bring it to the Seer.

plots: NONE
title: A Forged Path
objective: deliver false orders to the Stormcloak commander in Dawnstar
tasks: convince an innkeeper to help you get some real Stormcloak orders
description:
I need you to deliver some false orders to the Stormcloak commander in Dawnstar. But first we need to get our hands on some rebel orders to make the forgeries.
The Nightgate and Candlehearth inns are frequent stops for Stormcloak runners. See if you can't "convince" one of those innkeepers to help you. One way or another, get me those documents.
Show the rebels the futility of their cause.

plots: the player has the Elder Scroll
title: Alduin's Bane
objective: defeat Alduin
tasks: take the Elder Scroll to the Time-Wound
description:
You have it. The Scroll - the Elder Scroll. Time bends... touch. Time shudders at its touch. There is no question. You are doom-driven. Blessings of Akatosh. The very bones of the earth are at your disposal.
Go then. Fulfill your destiny. Take the Scroll to the Time-Wound. Do not delay. Alduin will be coming. He cannot miss the signs. You must defeat him.

plots: NONE
title: The Adventure Continues
objective: restart your adventure
tasks: ask Felicia to show you the way
description: You seem weary - perhaps you are in need of a fresh perspective. If you so desire, I can allow you to retrace your steps with all of the knowledge you currently possess. Simply ask, and I can show you the way!

plots: Bolli sells his catch across Skyrim
title: Special Delivery
objective: help Bolli sell his fish to an untapped market
tasks: Go to The Silver Blood Inn.
deliver a purchase agreement to Kleppr
description:
I'm Bolli, a fisherman.
I sell my catch across a good portion of Skyrim... it's worth its weight in gold to me. The only untapped market left is Markarth. However, I just got word that Kleppr at The Silver Blood Inn might be interested.
If you're headed that way, I would appreciate you delivering a purchase agreement for me. You'd be paid, of course. Kleppr will pay you as soon as you arrive with the letter. Here you are.

plots: NONE
title: The Malicious Ones
objective: prevent the Ezrohir from defiling the water supply of Zeryphesh
description: The Ezrohir have installed some infernal devices in the Undercurrents, defiling the supply of water entering Zeryphesh. You must destroy those machines, or Zeryphesh cannot stand against the Ezrohir!

plots: NONE
title: The Fishing Job
objective: steal an item out of a mark's pocket for the Thieves Guild
description:
There are all sorts of people wandering around carryin' their valuables on their person... just waitin' for someone like you to pick their pocket. So, you in for a little fishin'?
One of our marks seems to have an item of value we want to add to our vault. Get it for us and you'll receive the usual pay. Sound good?

plots: NONE
title: Hide and Seek
objective: kill a vampire masquerading as a regular citizen without being accused of murder
description:
I've located the whereabouts of a vampire masquerading as a common citizen in Solitude. Track him down and dispose of him.
Vampires enjoy stalking their prey. Passing among us undetected emboldens them. Makes them feel powerful, untouchable. But we'll put a swift end to that.
Tread lightly. The vampire can cloud the minds of those he preys upon. It won't be easy to convince anyone he's other than he appears. The law is unaware of the danger and will treat you as a criminal if you are caught. You must be clever. Find a way not to be caught or accused of murder.
We must be vigilant and self sufficient if we are to defeat these monsters.

plots: NONE
title: The Bedlam Job
objective: steal whatever you can to make an impression
tasks: steal from anywhere in Whiterun without anyone seeing you steal
description:
Sometimes we like to remind a city that we mean business, so we hit it hard. Just steal whatever we can until we've made an impression.
Simple right? Almost. The catch is it doesn't count if anyone sees you take it. The message needs to be clear; we work in the shadows.
Steal from anywhere in Whiterun, and you even get to keep everythin' you stole. So, you in?

plots: the player is a member of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
Sythillisian Empire has invaded Amnian lands
title: Knights Rescue
objective: rescue the knights of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
tasks: repel the invasion to the Amnian outpost
description:
Welcome. I, William Reirrac, have been awaiting you. You should know the particulars of your service here and what being a member of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart really means.
You are aware of the conflict with the Sythillisian Empire? There have been invasions into Amnian lands. We have been monitoring outposts, and all is not well. One outpost reported an imminent attack because an enemy unit needed their supplies. A runner barely made it with the information, and we fear the worst.
You must leave immediately for the furthest lengths of the Umar Hills. You must join the combat and rescue our knights, for they are surely outnumbered.
Go, and rescue whom you can. You have little time.

plots: General Tullius is addressing the player and the player's fellow legionnaires: the best and the brightest warriors in Tamriel
title: Extinguishing the Flames of Rebellion
objective: put an end to the Stormcloak rebellion
tasks: fight your way in Ulric's castle, and make Ulfric face justice
description:
All right. It's time to deliver the final blow to the Stormcloak rebellion. You all have fought bravely, and sacrificed much to bring us to this point.
Ulfric thinks he can hide behind the walls of his castle. But we will fight our way in and drag him out through the rubble to face justice. Because this is the end for them, the Stormcloaks will fight like cornered rats. They will be fierce and crafty. But they are no match for Legionnaires.
You are the best and the brightest warriors in Tamriel. Professional soldiers, fearless and devastating. The Emperor will be paying close attention to what happens here today. Men who distinguish themselves will be well rewarded.
Ready now! Everyone, with me! For the Empire! For the Legion!

plots: Lazarus Librarus' does not have anything for the player to purchase
Lazarus Librarus' spellbook was stolen: he cannot fashion scrolls without his spellbook
Lazarus Librarus suspected Hectan, but he was at the local pub from dusk until dawn the night of the theft
title: Lazarus' Missing Spellbook
objective: return Lazarus Librarus' spellbook to him
description:
Lazarus Librarus at your service. I would normally invite you to look at my magical wares, but alas, my shelves are completely bare. I have not even a single parchment left for you to purchase.
My spellbook has been stolen! Without it, I cannot fashion the powerful scrolls which normally fill my shop. Please, mighty traveler... I beg of you to help a humble wizard! At first, I suspected Hectan... he is well known about town for his sticky fingers. But after questioning many witnesses, it is clear that Hectan was at the local pub from dusk until dawn the night of the theft. I still suspect that no-good thief Hectan was involved — I can clearly see the guilt in his face! But there is no proof. Without my spellbook, I am virtually powerless to pursue this myself, and as a newcomer to this town, I have no one to turn to for help.
I regret that there is little else I can tell you. Hectan can usually be found in the Tankard Tree if you wish to question him.
I urge you godspeed.

plots: the player asked Bujold the Unworthy what is going on here
title: Retaking Thirsk
objective: help Bujold the Unworthy and his warriors retake Thirsk Mead Hall
tasks: fight Rieklings with Bujold the Unworthy and his warriors
description:
What's going on here is that we've been kicked out of our home. The Thirsk Mead Hall, up there on the hill. We were... some Rieklings have taken it over.
Rieklings overcame us with tenacity and numbers. Didn't help that we'd grown a little too comfortable up there. Too much mead. Too many stories. Too few battles.
Are you... offering to help? Some new blood should be enough to rouse these layabouts to actually fight again.

plots: Farkas knows where the player might find the dragon
title: Dragon Seekers
objective: kill a dragon with Farkas
description:
Travelers have been coming to Whiterun. They tell stories about dragons. I've heard of them, but didn't think they were real.
Rumors also claim that you have defeated dragons before. You are a very brave person worthy of being a Companion. But I already knew that.
Let's go kill a dragon together. That's one way to find out if they're real. I even know where we might find one. Lead on!

plots: the Gourmet is the last target before he Dark Brotherhood strikes out at the emperor: the Gourmet is scheduled to cook for the emperor at a special dinner
Festus is close to uncovering the identity of the Gourmet
title: Recipe for Disaster
objective: kill the Gourmet, steal his writ of passage, and assume his identity
description:
There's just one more target before we strike out at the Emperor.
Have you by chance heard of the "Gourmet"? Read his cookbook? It's become quite a phenomenon. The Gourmet is scheduled to cook for the Emperor at a special dinner.
You'll kill him, steal his Writ of Passage, and assume the role of master chef. Festus has been spearheading this part of the assassination plan. He's close to uncovering the identity of the Gourmet.
You should report to him.

plots: the gate guards have reported seeing strangers on the road for the past several nights: Jauffre cannot leave Cloud Ruler undefended while his men search the whole mountainside
Jauffre has asked the Countess of Bruma to have the guard keep an eye out for strangers
title: Spies
objective: track down the spies, kill them and find out what they know
description:
I hope you can help. The gate guards have reported seeing strangers on the road for the past several nights.
I cannot leave Cloud Ruler undefended while my men search the whole mountainside, but these spies must be eliminated. Talk to Steffan. He can tell you where he has seen them. Captain Burd in Bruma may also be able to help. I've asked the authorities of Bruma to have the guard keep an eye out for strangers.
Track down the spies and kill them. Find out what they know, and what they're planning, if possible.

plots: NONE
title: Dampened Spirits
objective: put the Honningbrew Meadery out of business by putting Sabjorn in prison
tasks: talk to Mallus Maccius for details
description:
This is an important job. I have a competitor called Honningbrew Meadery that I want to put out of business. I also want to know how they managed to get the place up and running so quickly.
Some layabout named Sabjorn runs the Honningbrew Meadery. Been a thorn in my side for the last few years now. With Sabjorn in prison, his meadery will be forced to close. Then I swoop in and take over the place. No more competition.
Head to the Bannered Mare in Whiterun and look for Mallus Maccius. He'll fill you in on all the details.

plots: NONE
title: A Tab to Pay
objective: convince Ranmir pay his debts to Haran
description:
Ranmir owes this tavern enough coin to burn it down, build it back up, then burn it down again just for laughs.
He's had some troubles in his life, but I can't have him drinking here without at least paying back some of the coin he owes.
Go right ahead and talk to him. He just might be sober enough to listen to you.

plots: Albert gives the player Rufie's chew toy to draw out Rufie
title: Albert and His Dog
objective: bring Rufie to Albert
description:
Hi! I'm Albert.
'Scuse me. I ever so sowwy to bother, but could you help me? I've lost my little dog Rufie and I can't find him. He's probably ever so scared wight now. Poor Rufie isn't used to strange places an' people. You're sure to know him when you see him, 'cuz he's just the cutest little thing. Here, take this as well. His favorite chew toy, it is. He'll know you're a friend if you have it in your hands.
I have a small reward for you: it's another of his chew things, but we can get more where we're going.

plots: NONE
title: Tower of the Moon
objective: see if there are Ezrohir scouts at the Tower of the Moon
tasks: Go to Tower of the Moon.
deal with any Ezrohir scouts you find
description:
My friend, I have a mission for you. You may have noticed the Ezrohir activity in the Ossean Wastes. We believe these are scouts operating out of the Forsaken Vaults, but they are appearing so close to the city gates that we think they might have a base much nearer, from which they are spying on us.
We have narrowed down the possibilities, and I want you to look into the Tower of the Moon, an ancient tower jutting from the Ossean Wastes. Determine if there are any Ezrohir scouts there... and if you find any, deal with them.

plots: the Blades killed the dragons off centuries ago
title: A Blade in the Dark
objective: help Delphine stop dragons from coming back to life
tasks: go to an ancient dragon burial with Delphine, and kill a dragon
description:
Dragons aren't just coming back, they're coming back to life. They weren't gone somewhere for all these years. They were dead, killed off centuries ago by my predecessors. Now something's happening to bring them back to life. And I need you to help me stop it.
I've visited their ancient burial mounds and found them empty. And I've figured out where the next one will come back to life. We're going to go there, and you're going to kill that dragon. If we succeed, I'll tell you anything you want to know.
We are going to Kynesgrove. There's an ancient dragon burial near there. If we can get there before the dragon comes back, maybe we'll learn how to stop it.

plots: Scar knows the player
every night people have been disappearing from the streets of the city
possible tracks of a many-legged centipede-like monster have been found
title: Missing Citizens
objective: discover what's been happening with the disappearing citizens, and come see Scar
tasks: patrol and find an entrance to the sewers
description:
It is I, Scar, second-in-command of the Flaming Fist. I have another job you might be interested in. You'll be well paid for your services.
The problem is this: Every night people have been disappearing from the streets of the city. My men have been scouring the city trying to find the culprit, but so far to no avail. People have begun to get scared, and very few are willing to leave their homes at night. Something has to be done, and quickly. Would you be willing to take the job? I'd pay you 300 gold in advance with a 1,000 gold bonus if you discover what's been happening with the disappearing citizens.
Your job is really simple. All I want you to do is patrol the east of the city and find an entrance to the sewers. Perhaps you'll get lucky and find out what's been happening. If you do find out what's been happening, come to see me at the Flaming Fist barracks. Our only clue so far has led us to the sewers, so if you want to explore them first, it would probably be a good idea. Also, we've found tracks of some many-legged creature, perhaps a centipede-like monster.

plots: Tacitus is not learning smithing by example: Ghorza gra-Bagol thinks that 'The Last Scabbard of Akrash' could help him learn
title: Skilled Apprenticeship
objective: bring 'The Last Scabbard of Akrash' to Ghorza gra-Bagol
tasks: find a copy of 'The Last Scabbard of Akrash'
description:
You'd think an apprentice could forge a few hinges. Not Tacitus. I keep showing him how to treat the iron, but he never gets it.
In the Legion, the Imperial smiths used to read books when they couldn't set their hammers straight. Wisdom of the old, I guess. If you find a book called 'The Last Scabbard of Akrash', could you bring it to me? Tacitus sure isn't learning by example.
Books. Don't know why the Imperials like them so much. It should help the boy, though, Malacath willing. Bring the book, and I'll show you how an Orc learns to smith.

plots: the player came for their free armor
the player only gets one free outfit
title: Get Outfitted
objective: get a free set of armor
tasks: select light, medium, or heavy armor
description:
I have just one question for you. Light, medium, or heavy?
Light armor for scouting detail, heavy armor for full on combat, or something in between?
Now, that'll be it. One free outfit per soldier. You lose that, or get it banged up, you'll need to pay like everyone else.

plots: many have tried to survive the Arena of Slaughter: now their souls serve Grom
title: Grom's Arena
objective: prove your worth to Grom
tasks: attempt to survive the Arena of Slaughter
description:
So... you come seeking the wealth of Grom? My spoils are vast, and have no peer in this realm.
There is no path to success for you, lest you survive my arena and prove your worth.
Be forewarned - many have tested their mettle on this bloodstained floor, but none have yet succeeded. Their souls are now mine, and they do as they are bid.
Will you attempt the challenge? I will await your decision.
None have yet triumphed within the walls of my arena.
Perhaps you will be the first?
Perhaps...

TESO502: County Hall, in the Cheydinhal castle
TESO505: County Hall, in the Cheydinhal castle

plots: Llevana Nedaren does not know the player
Ulrich Leland is fining the citizens of Cheydinhal enthusiastically
title: Corruption and Conscience
objective: do something about Ulrich Leland
tasks: speak to Garrus Darelliun, the second-in-command of the guard, about Ulrich Leland
description:
You seem far too nice to be one of Ulrich Leland's men. What can I do for you?
Don't even get me started about Ulrich. That madman won't be satisfied until everyone in town is dead broke...or in jail! What in Oblivion is Ulrich doing with all that money anyway? I'm sure he's lining his pockets with the gold of the good citizens of Cheydinhal.
There's only one man who seems to care: Garrus Darelliun, the second-in-command of the guard. I hear he isn't happy with Ulrich. I don't know what you can do for us in this situation. I mean, Ulrich Leland is the Captain after all.
Perhaps you could speak to Garrus. You can find him roaming the County Hall of the castle most of the time.

plots: Mazoga might have had contacts with outlaws in her shadowy past
title: Knights of the White Stallion
objective: kill Black Brugo with Mazoga
tasks: ask Mazoga about locating Black Brugo
description:
You and Mazoga are to find and kill the leader of the Black Bow Bandits, the Orc named Brugo.
In her shadowy past, your friend Mazoga might have had contacts with outlaws. Ask her about locating Brugo and his Black Bow Bandits.
I have created a chivalric Order of the White Stallion. If you succeed, I will bestow on both you and Mazoga the titles of Knights-Errant of the White Stallion for your service to Leyawiin.

plots: Keldorn's wife has been seeing Sir William of Thorpe
Sir William of Thorpe has challenged Keldorn's honor
title: Adulterer's lot
objective: bestow some justice on Sir William of Thorpe
tasks: go find Sir William of Thorpe with Keldorn
description:
My wife has been seeing another man. Sir William of Thorpe... He's a foreign noble establishing trade here in Athkatla. He was a good man — at least I always thought so until... until now.
My friend, let us bestow some justice. Sir William has challenged my honor. There must be a reprisal.
We must make haste to the Mithrest in the Promenade District. I cannot live like this for long.

plots: in Black Marsh, tradition dictates Argonians present a potential mate a unique wedding ring to represent their future bond: Talen-Jei already has a gold band for Keerava's wedding ring
title: Sealing the Deal
objective: help Talen-Jei complete Keerava's wedding ring
tasks: find three flawless amethysts for Keerava's wedding ring
description:
I met Keerava when I wandered into Riften a few years ago. Been smitten with her ever since. In fact, I'm thinking of asking her to marry me.
In Black Marsh, tradition dictates we present a potential mate a unique wedding ring to represent our future bond. I already have the gold band, but all I need are three flawless amethysts to complete the setting.

plots: people around here have not been able to sleep for a week
title: Zombie Infestation
objective: return to Wenric after killing all zombies
description:
I be Wenric, a farmer by profession.
There's been something killing peoples in and 'round the farms here. Zombies or something. I can understands if you can't stomach the task but, just between you an' me real personal-likes, I don't know who else is gonna do it... All of us haves been goin' for a week now without sleep.
We've counted twenty zombies or so, so keep track as you kill 'em, if that's what you plans on doing.
Once you got 'em all, come back here and I'll gives you the 150 gold pieces that some of us have pooled together.

plots: this plague targets beings of an inherently magical nature, not humans
title: Trail of the Grand Regent
objective: go to the Watchweald Temple
tasks: take Crows' Pass to the Frosted Hills to catch up to the Grand Regent before he enters the Watchweald Temple
description:
This plague seems to specifically target beings of an inherently magical nature, such as the Estherians. So far it's not affecting humans, so I've sent for a transport to bring us some medical supplies, and I'll be coordinating the medical relief here.
Meanwhile, you need to get out to the Watchweald Temple. Take Crows' Pass to the Frosted Hills. Try to catch up to the Grand Regent before he enters the temple.

plots: the Greymarch has swept the Fringe
title: Retaking the Fringe
objective: defend the Fringe
tasks: help Sheogorath's armies to retake the Fringe from the forces of Order
description:
The Greymarch has swept the Fringe. Order gathers its forces there as we speak. And I hate when people gather forces in My Fringe. You'll need to put an end to that. Stop them.
My armies should already be there, but I want you to see what you can do to help. If they continue to marshal their forces there, we won't be able to contain them. Make sure they can't.

plots: the Eye was stolen from its shrine and hid in dark waters
title: Nocturnal's Missing Eye
objective: bring Nocturnal's Eye back to Nocturnal
description:
Night among strangers. Secrets in the dark. Nocturnal is here.
But my Eye is blind and drowned, stolen from its shrine, and hid in dark waters. To steal from a god is most unwise. In Leyawiin, two Argonians think themselves secret, but the Eye has seen them.
Find these thieves in the city that spans the waters. Learn where they hide my Eye. Retrieve the Eye of Nocturnal, mortal, and return it to me, and I shall look favorably upon you.
You, mortal, may take this Skeleton Key upon your return. It shall open the secrets of dark places for you.

plots: the player has worked for Bodhi before
Aran Linvail is in the basement of the Shadow Thief guild house: the player needs a key to the basement
Tizzak is missing, and the Shadow Thieves may have him: he may know how to access Aran Linvail's sanctum
title: To Kill a Guild
objective: kill Aran Linvail
tasks: find a way to access Aran Linvail's sanctum
description:
Again, I require your talents. Now to the task at hand.
It is time to take down the leadership of the Shadow Thieves and throw them into a more permanent disarray from which they may not recover. You must invade their lair one last time. You must kill Aran Linvail, the Shadowmaster. Do this for me, and our arrangement will be fulfilled.
Aran is in the basement of the Shadow Thief guild house, so you need a key. The lock is likely unpickable. What good is a lock in a thieves' guild if any thief can pick it?
One more thing: Tizzak, an employee of mine, is missing, and the Thieves may have him. Find him, and he may tell you how to access Aran's sanctum. Go now!

plots: NONE
title: A Ring for a Lady
objective: bring an angel skin ring to Fergus
description:
I'm Fergus, a very happy man.
I've got to admit, I ain't never been happier. Got a letter from my lady and she's gonna be home reeeal soon... Just gotta find me a pretty little ring for her pretty little finger and all's gonna be just fine, just fine. But my lady, she transcends gold or silver or fancy stones. She'll have nothing less than an angel skin ring from me.
For reward, if you're ever needin' a little work around here, check with Scar, second-in-command of the city guard. You can tell him I recommended you.

plots: NONE
title: Acrobatics Training
objective: seek acrobatics training from Aerin
description:
Ganredhel. I train dogs. And people.
Prefer dogs. People, I teach them advanced acrobatics. Up and jump. Dogs, I teach them to bite people.
If you require further training, you might consider venturing into the mountains in the north of Cyrodiil. Aerin's Camp, specifically.
Aerin's a very gifted acrobat, and could teach you anything you needed to know.

plots: NONE
title: Bounty: Warbeasts!
objective: help colonists by thinning out packs of Warbeasts
description:
BOUNTY!
Commander Vale of the Vanquisher Corps is offering a reward to anyone who can help thin out the packs of Warbeasts hampering colonization and defense efforts in Estheria.
This reward shall be paid to anyone who slays 10 or more Warbeasts in the Temple Steppes.

plots: Dennis is the leader of a mercenary band from Riatavin
Roger might have bought Dennis' family gong
title: Recover Dennis' Mother's Gong
objective: find Dennis' family gong
description:
I be Dennis... the leader of mercenary fellows out o' Riatavin.
Me gong was stolen. The gong belonged to my mother... it was her dowry and worth a great deal of coin. A damnable lout stole it before my gong lessons were even finished!
The lout sold it to a fence by the name of Roger not too long ago, I do think. He lives in the sewers below th' city, although I knows not exactly where. He might still have it.
Please find me family gong!

plots: Sibbi Black-Briar agreed to sell Frost to Louis Letrush
Maven Black-Briar threw Sibbi Black-Briar in Riften Jail before he delivered Frost to Louis Letrush: Sibbi Black-Briar thinks that this exempts him from selling Frost to Louis Letrush
title: Promises to Keep
objective: help Louis Letrush get Frost and his lineage papers from Sibbi Black-Briar
tasks: talk to Sibbi Black-Briar about Frost and the lineage papers
description:
I'm Louis Letrush. Looking for work? I need someone to deliver a message to Sibbi Black-Briar.
I recently approached Sibbi Black-Briar about buying Frost, one of the finest breeding horses in the realm. He agreed to sell. I paid Sibbi half the cost of Frost up front, but before he could deliver, Maven had him locked up. Sibbi believes this exempts him from our deal. It does not.
Head to the Riften Jail and talk to Sibbi. Get him to tell you where Frost and his Lineage Papers are and bring them to me outside Riften. You'll be well paid for your time.

plots: Captain Aldis trains recruits: he thought about asking some training books from the general
title: Lessons on Defense
objective: bring Captain Aldis a copy of "The Mirror"
description:
I'm with the Imperial Legion. Train the recruits. Turn boys into men. That sort of thing.
Thinking of asking the General for some training books. Give the soldiers something to do while they're on rest. Something besides drinking. Ever seen a book called "The Mirror"? We used to hand it out to boys looking to learn basic shield work.
If you find a copy of "The Mirror", I'd be glad to have it. Then I'll see if I can get some copies made for the men.

plots: the binding terms of the oath with Nocturnal: the player will be required to defend the Twilight Sepulcher and everything within when the need arises, and upon the player's death, the player's spirit will be bound to the Twilight Sepulcher as one of its guardians
title: Trinity Restored
objective: transact the oath with Nocturnal and become one of the Nightingales
tasks: undergo the ceremony to become a Nightingale
description:
Are you ready to transact the Oath with Nocturnal?
By transacting the Oath with Nocturnal, you're entering into a business deal. You'll be provided all of the power and knowledge befitting a Nightingale. You're free to use those powers as you see fit to further your own goals or the goals of the Thieves Guild.
In return, you'll be required to defend the Twilight Sepulcher and everything within when the need arises. More importantly, upon your death, your spirit will be bound to the Twilight Sepulcher as one of its guardians.
Once the Oath has been struck, the terms are binding. Knowing this, are you ready to undergo the ceremony?

plots: the player asked Marise Aravel how she keeps the food she sells so fresh
title: Ice Cold
objective: bring five ice wraith teeth to Marise Aravel
description:
I picked up a trick from a master butcher. He showed me a way to grind up ice wraith teeth and use it as a preservative. Keeps everything cold and fresh, but only for a limited time.
I'm always looking to replenish my supply, so if you ever come across five of them, I'd be more than happy to take them off your hands. The last traveler that traded me some said he found them at a place called Ancient's Ascent.
Careful though, rumor has it a dragon makes its home there.

plots: Fura was assigned to Whiterun after she joined the Imperial army
title: No News Is Good News
objective: find out information about Fura from Captain Aldis
description:
You're a traveler, correct? Have you been to Whiterun?
My daughter, Fura, was assigned to Whiterun after she joined the Imperial Army. I was hoping you might have met her. I haven't heard from her lately. I've tried talking to Captain Aldis but he hasn't been any help.
It would be very sweet of you to get more information about my daughter. Anything you can find out from Captain Aldis would be welcome news.

plots: Hurgan Stoneblade's grandpa was killed by a demon
Durlag intended to send "Soultaker" to Hurgan Stoneblade's mother
Durlag did not send "Soultaker": his family was replaced with doppelgangers and he was driven mad after killing the doppelgangers
title: Recovering "Soultaker"
objective: bring the "Soultaker" to Hurgan Stoneblade
description:
I am Hurgan Stoneblade, presently residing in Citadel Adbar. Have I got the adventure that'll make ye yearn for glory!
Ye have heard of Durlag's Tower, mayhaps? Me granda' was a good friend of Durlag's. Me granda' was slain by an evil demon but Durlag survived. Durlag kept "Soultaker" that had been me granda's. He was going to send it to me mother, but he was betrayed. A sad tale, that.
After Durlag built the tower his family was replaced by doppelgangers. Durlag killed them all but was driven mad by the act. He entrapped his tower heavily and forgot about me granda's dagger.
If ye be interested, I wish to hire ye to retrieve me granda's dagger, "Soultaker," me birthright.
An enchanted hammer I can offer ye for yer services.

plots: the player has helped Estherians before
title: The Scroll of Anom-Irek
objective: retrieve the Scroll of Anom-Irek, and return to Miamin
tasks: find the Scroll of Anom-Irek in a vault
description:
You must be the human the other Estherians are speaking of. I am glad to have met you. I have been sent on a quest to recover the Scroll of Anom-Irek, stored in a vault in the Corrupted Crypt, here. The scroll should allow us to heal the Estherians who have been corrupted by evil spirits. Unfortunately, the Sturmbeorn have already entered the crypt, and I have been unable to get past them.
Can I ask you to attempt to retrieve the scroll? I will wait here in the Path of the Honored Dead for your return. Should you succeed, I will see what I can do to provide you with some equipment more fitting a hero of your stature.

plots: NONE
title: Song of the Alchemists
objective: bring Lami "Song of the Alchemists"
description:
I'm Lami, an alchemist. I picked up the alchemy trade when I was a girl. One of the temple healers staying here on a pilgrimage showed me the basics.
She had a book with her, "Song of the Alchemists", that I used to read over and over. I miss having a copy.
Could you find that book for me? I'd be happy to show you a bit about herbs if you find the book.

plots: Flydian was sent by the High Merchant
druids are suspected of the animal attacks
title: Animal trouble in Trademeet
objective: investigate why forest animals are attacking Trademeet
tasks: go talk with the High Merchant
description:
I am Flydian, a messenger sent by the High Merchant of Trademeet to find someone to help our town.
Trademeet is under attack by forest animals. The High Merchant thinks druids may be responsible, but we haven't the manpower to find them and stop it.
The High Merchant will have more information for you.

plots: NONE
title: Azra's Staffs
objective: retrieve a magical staff made by Azra Nightwielder for Neloth
description:
I have a slightly more personal request. You see, I'm a collector. Of staffs. Magical staffs. In particular, those made by Azra Nightwielder.
Azra Nightwielder was the original shadowmage. His advances in magic are legendary. Less well known is that he was also a pioneer in the field of enchanting staffs. Nightwielder's creations don't really hold up in comparison to what can be made today, but they have a sentimental value for me. You understand.
Through some divinations, I believe I've located one of Azra Nightwielder's staffs in Frostmere Depths. If you retrieve it, I'll give you a staff of my own making.

plots: disciples of Kynareth used to travel far to hear the winds of Kynareth in the Gildergreen's branches
title: The Blessings of Nature
objective: restore the Gildergreen with the sap of the Eldergleam
description:
This is the Gildergreen. It was planted as a seedling in the early years of Whiterun. Disciples of Kynareth could sense something holy in it, and traveled far to hear the winds of the goddess in its branches. Of course, not as many pilgrims these days. A big dead tree isn't very inspiring if you're coming to worship the divine of wind and rains. Kynareth gives life, and we need a living tree to be her symbol.
I've thought about restoring the Gildergreen... Trees like this never really die. They only slumber. I think if we had some of the sap from the parent tree, Eldergleam, we could wake up its child. But even if you could get to the Eldergleam, you couldn't tap it. Not with any normal metal. If you want to help, you'll need something to cut into it first.
Eldergleam is older than metal, from a time before men or elves. To even affect it, you have to tap into the old magic. You'll have to deal with the Hagravens. I've heard about a weapon they've made for sacrificing Kynareth's creations. It's called "Nettlebane." The hags terrify me, or I would have gone after it myself. It's held in a Hagraven nest called Orphan Rock

TESS28: Reach, trying to find dwarven ruins
TESS29: Reach, trying to find dwarven ruins
TESS30: Reach, trying to find dwarven ruins

plots: the Dawnguard is fighting against powerful vampires, who have an Elder Scroll
title: A New Order
objective: recruit Isran's old allies for the Dawnguard
tasks: find Sorine Jurard and Gunmar, and recruit them for the Dawnguard
description:
We're up against powerful vampires, unlike anything we've seen before. And they have an Elder Scroll.
There are people I've met and worked with over the years. We need their skills, their talents, if we're going to survive this.
I think we'll want Sorine Jurard. Breton girl, whip-smart and good with tinkering. Fascination with the Dwemer. Weapons in particular. Last I knew, she was out in the Reach, convinced she was about to find the biggest dwarven ruins yet. You'll also want to find Gunmar. Big brute of a Nord, hates vampires almost as much as I do. Got it into his head years back that his experience with animals would help. Trolls in particular, from what I hear.
If you can find them, we might have a chance.

plots: the player is not an Orc or blood-kin to the Orcs: the player is not welcome at the Orc stronghold by the code of Malacath
title: The Forgemaster's Fingers
objective: bring the Forgemaster's Fingers, an enchanted pair on gauntlets, to the chief of the Orcs
description:
Halt, outlander. By the Code of Malacath, this stronghold belongs to the Orcs. Your kind are unwelcome. You're not an Orc, or Blood-Kin, so stay out. We only help our own.
Hmm... there is a way to become Blood-Kin, if you truly insist on entering our stronghold. We've heard whispers of an enchanted pair of gauntlets, hidden and protected by dangerous men, beasts, or worse.
They are called the Forgemaster's Fingers. Find them at Stony Creek Cave. Bring them to our chief, and he will decide if you're worthy to be Blood-Kin to the Orcs.

plots: the player is hurting their prisoner
title: No More Pain
objective: find your prisoner's treasure for yourself
tasks: get your prisoner's hidden things from a hollowed-out rock
description:
I'll tell you anything. Anything! Just please stop... hurting me... I just... can't take the pain. Not a second longer.
I'll give you money. Treasure. I have some things hidden away. Take them all. They're yours. Just please... stop. Just north of Windhelm. There's a hollowed-out rock. I have some things hidden in there. Take them! They're yours.
I've told you everything I can. I don't know what else you could want...

plots: the player showed Trill-Bot 4000 a robot component
title: Getting One's Bearings
objective: find the Azimuthoscope
tasks: follow the trail of Trill-Bot 4000's parts
description:
I believe you have found one of my missing components! There appears to be a trail of them, leading toward that dungeon.
If you follow the trail of my Parts, it might lead you to my Azimuthoscope: the component I need to direct you to another treasure trove!

plots: NONE
title: The Eve of War
objective: save the Guardian of Mana from the Alchemist and Netherim
tasks: seek the Forsaken Vaults, and convince the Sphinx to grant you entry
description:
I have been expecting you. I am the Guardian of Air.
The Guardian of Mana has pursued the Alchemist into the Forsaken Vaults, which are guarded by the Sphinx. Seek the Vaults, and convince the Sphinx to grant you entry. The Guardian of Mana is in great danger... if not from the Alchemist, then from the Netherim. Save her.

plots: Rythe makes lifelike paintings about the Great Forest
Rythe keeps his studio locked: he did not come out of his studio for a full day
Tivela Lythandas unlocked the studio with the key Rythe said to use only in emergencies: Rythe was not inside his studio
Tivela Lythandas gives the player the key to Rythe's studio
Tivela Lythandas will be around the house should the player need her
title: A Brush with Death
objective: help Tivela Lythandas find her husband who has gone missing
description:
I'm Tivela Lythandas. I apologize that I can't give you the respect a guest in my home would normally receive, but I am at my wit's end. I am sorry to be so forward, but I desperately need your help. It seems that my husband, Rythe, has gone missing, and I just don't know what to do.
Rythe is known far and wide as one of the best painters in all Cyrodiil. His specialty is setting the Great Forest to canvas. The paintings look so amazingly real that some say they can see the trees sway in the breeze. That's a silly notion of course, but it just goes to show the attention to detail Rythe uses when he paints.
Rythe likes to work in his studio with the door locked, so no one can disturb him. He usually comes out to eat dinner and sleep, but two days ago, he didn't come out at all. At first, I wasn't worried. He does that occasionally. But when he didn't come out for a full day, I unlocked the studio with the key he said to use only in emergencies. It turned out he wasn't inside! I'm sure he never left that room. So I have no idea where he's gone.
Please. Help me find Rythe. I love him dearly, and I am so worried. Here's the key to Rythe's studio. You may come and go as you please. If you need me, I'll be around the house.

BG1292: northeast of the village, in the woods
BG1293: northeast of the village, in the woods

plots: Maralee's husband took Peladan hunting: werewolves attacked Peladan and his father
Peladan went missing, but Maralee's husband was killed
Peladan and Maralee's husband have dark hair
title: Maralee's Child
objective: return Peladan to Maralee
description:
Hello, good people. I am Maralee. Two moons ago my husband took my son out hunting with him. They were attacked by those horrible wolf-creatures. They... they killed my husband and took my baby.
Others say that they took the baby away to eat him, but I know he's still alive. He's a beautiful little boy with dark hair like his father. He is three moons old and his name is Peladan.
They took him from my husband northeast of the village, in the woods.

plots: a tasloi stole Gurke's cloak in Cloakwood
title: Gurke's Cloak
objective: return Gurke's cloak to him
tasks: find the tasloi holding Gurke's cloak
description:
Old Gurke had his famous cloak stolen right off his back by a batch of paltry tasloi.
Yeah, yeah, it's old news and if you make one crack about the Cloakwood being an appropriate place to lose it, at least, I'll put your liver on the menu. Now move on and let the next people in line have their laugh.
However, if you happen to find my cloak, I'll give you 280 gold pieces for returning it.

plots: the player killed the Gourmet for Astrid: the player is the Listener of the Dark Brotherhood
Astrid gives the player Jarrin Root
after assassination, escape through the upper door, and across the bridge: Astrid has "arranged" for it to be unguarded
title: To Kill an Empire
objective: assassinate Titus Mede II while disguised as the Gourmet
tasks: present the Gourmet's writ of passage to Commander Maro to gain unrestricted access to the kitchens, and poison Titus Mede II's meal with Jarrin Root
description:
So it's done. You've killed the Gourmet. And now Titus Mede II is as good as dead.
I've decided you will have the honor of killing the Emperor. Go now to Castle Dour in Solitude. Present the Gourmet's Writ of Passage to the officer in charge, Commander Maro.
You'll gain unrestricted access to the kitchens, and then the Emperor. You're posing as a chef, so you'll be able to poison his meal rather easily. Here, take this - it's called jarrin root. All it takes is one taste, and the effects are quite immediate. The Emperor will be serving Sithis before he even knows he's dead. Once Mede has been killed, escape through the upper door, and across the bridge. I've "arranged" for it to be unguarded once the alarm is sounded.
Now go, my friend. Go, and fulfill your destiny as Listener.

plots: NONE
title: New Allegiances
objective: turn Valindor into a vampire, and return to Vingalmo
tasks: use vampiric seduction on Valindor, embrace him and bite him on the neck
description:
I've found a new candidate, ripe for the Gift. I'm sending you to welcome this soul into our family.
Valindor of Riften has his ears in places that we'd love to listening in. Joining our family should increase our possibilities in the south.
Put his mind to rest, allay his fear through vampiric seduction and when he is in a pliant condition, embrace him and bite him on the neck.
When you offer the embrace, do so away from prying eyes. Our new sibling will then likely require rest while his blood undergoes the change. Return to me when your part is done.

plots: Astrid told the player about killing the Gourmet and taking his identity
the player should hide the Gourmet's body if they can
title: Recipe for Death
objective: assassinate the Gourmet, a famous master chef, and get his Writ of Passage to assume his identity
tasks: question Anton Virane to learn the true identity of the Gourmet, and kill Anton Virane
description:
Let's get down to business. Astrid told you about the Gourmet, I hope? That you need to kill him and take on his identity?
But first you'll need to learn who he is. Assuming, of course, that the Gourmet actually is a "he." Could be a woman for all we know. In my, um, investigations, I came upon this. It's a copy of the Gourmet's cookbook. Ah, but not just any copy. It's signed you see! Seems to be a message from the Gourmet to one Anton Virane. I've tracked Virane to the keep in Markarth. It would seem he's the cook.
You are to obtain that information from Virane - who the Gourmet really is, and where he can be found. Oh, and when you're done with Virane, kill him. Loose ends and all that.
As I was saying... You'll need to kill the Gourmet, of course. But what's more, you'll need to get his Writ of Passage, so you can take his place. Oh, and if you can, hide his body. The longer it takes for anyone else to determine his real identity, the better.
Now off with you!

plots: no one has seen anyone enter or leave the Abandoned House
title: The House of Horrors
objective: investigate the Abandoned House with Tyranus
tasks: follow Tyranus inside the Abandoned House
description:
Excuse me, but do you know anything about this house? Seen anyone enter or leave? Seems no one in this city has.
I'm with the Vigil of Stendarr. We believe this house might have been used for Daedra worship. Evil rites and so forth. I was actually just about to head on inside. Be good to have someone watch my back.
Follow me, and keep your eyes open. Daedra are powerful creatures and tricksters. Never know what you'll find.

TESS369: fire salts, strange minerals that burns as hot as lava
TESS370: fire salts, strange minerals that burns as hot as lava

plots: Balimund's forge consumes fire salts
title: Stoking the Flames
objective: bring 10 fire salts to restore Balimund's forge
description:
Come to see Balimund perform miracles with steel, eh? Smithing's been in my blood for generations.
I owe my success to my forefathers and their recipe for flame. The secret is my forge. It consumes fire salts, a strange mineral that burns as hot as lava.
Sadly, this forge is dying and I've used the last of my fire salts. If I can't feed it soon, it may grow cold. Ten pinches of fire salts should give me all I need to bring this forge back to life.
Could you get the fire salts for me? I know that they are hard to come by, but they would save my business and warm an old smith's heart.

plots: the Companions are nearly five thousand years old: the Companions became werewolves a few hundred years ago when the Glenmoril witches promised to grant the Companions great power in exchange for hunting their lord Hircine
the Companions were deceived: lycanthropy affects not just the Companions' bodies, but the Companions' spirits as well
title: Blood's Honor
objective: claim the head of a Glenmoril Witch so that Kodlak Whitemane can cure the Companions' lycanthropy
tasks: seek out the Glenmoril witches, kill them, and collect their heads
description:
Have you heard the story of how we came to be werewolves?
The Companions are nearly five thousand years old. This matter of beastblood has only troubled us for a few hundred. One of my predecessors was a good, but short-sighted man. He made a bargain with the witches of Glenmoril Coven. If the Companions would hunt in the name of their lord, Hircine, we would be granted great power.
The Companions of old became werewolves. They did not believe the change would be permanent. The witches offered payment, like anyone else. But we had been deceived. The disease, you see, affects not just our bodies. It seeps into the spirit. Upon death, werewolves are claimed by Hircine for his Hunting Grounds. For some, this is a paradise. They want nothing more than to chase prey with their master for eternity. And that is their choice. But I am still a true Nord. And I wish for Sovngarde as my spirit home.
I've spent my twilight years trying to find a cure myself. And now I've found the answer. The witches' magic ensnared us, and only their magic can release us. They won't give it willingly, but we can extract their foul powers by force. I want you to seek them out. Go to their coven in the wilderness. Strike them down as a true warrior of the wild. And bring me their heads. The seat of their abilities. From there, we may begin to undo centuries of impurity.

plots: the player raided Sarthis' warehouse and killed him for Laila Law-Giver: the player knows where the source of the Skooma is
title: Supply and Demand
objective: destroy the source of Skooma and report back to Laila Law-Giver
tasks: go to the source of Skooma
description:
It's nice to receive good news for a change. Did you recover anything else from the warehouse worth mentioning?
If you have discovered the source of Skooma, then there's no time to lose. It won't take long for Sarthis's associates to learn of his death. The source of the poison must be destroyed once and for all, otherwise another dealer will simply take his place.
Do this task for me and you'll be well on your way to a title in Riften. Report back to me when your task is complete.

plots: the player asked mysticism training from Dagail
title: Mysticism Training
objective: strengthen the barriers between the worlds
description:
Training, child? You would know more about the mystic energies of the world around us?
The barriers between planes are weak. Do more to strengthen them; seal the portals to Oblivion. Then we shall speak of training.

plots: Avrusa Sarethi is keeping a a tight rein on Aduri
title: Smooth Jazbay
objective: collect 20 Jazbay Grapes for  Avrusa Sarethi so that she can cultivate her supply of Nirnroot
description:
Sigh. I've got my hands full here. Between the farm chores, cultivating my supply of Nirnroot and keeping a tight rein on my sister Aduri, there's little time for rest.
Could you help me? One of the ingredients I need to cultivate Nirnroot are Jazbay Grapes... the acidic content of the juice is perfect for the soil. I need twenty of them for my current crop.
I'll give you something for your efforts... finding all of them might not be easy... or cheap.

plots: Orchendor was sent to gather Afflicted to Bthardamz: Orchendor betrayed Peryite afterwards
title: The Only Cure
objective: kill Orchendor, and return to Peryite
description:
I have watched you for some time, you know. The decisions you've made intrigue me, and I wonder if you are the proper agent for a task of mine.
I sent a blessing to the world, a wasting plague that infected a scattering of Breton villages. One of my monks, the elf Orchendor, was sent to gather these Afflicted. He shepherded them into Bthardamz for me, but has since lost his way.
I will not stand for betrayal. I want you to go to Bthardamz and kill Orchendor, in my name. I can grant you a powerful token for this task. An escutcheon of dwarven make, capable of shielding you from both the spell and sword. Return when the elf lies dead and it will be yours.

plots: the Silver-Bloods are trying to get hold of Sanuarach Mine
sellswords showed up after Forsworn attacked Sanuarach Mine: sellswords won't let anyone work until Ainethach sells it off
title: Sanuarach Mine
objective: help Ainethach keep Sanuarach Mine
description:
The Silver-Bloods are trying to muscle in on my land. Forsworn attack the mines, and suddenly all these sellswords show up in Karthwasten to 'help.' They won't let anyone work until I sell it off.
You can try to convince them to leave, but I'd keep your sword-arm ready if things get ugly.

plots: Vitellus Donton was killed in action recently: the player may have seen the other wounded around
title: The Master's Son
objective: bolster Viranus Donton's confidence by find Galtus Previa in Nonwyll Cavern with Viranus Donton
tasks: take Viranus Donton on a mission with you
description:
I've got another job for you, slightly off the record. You'll be going on a mission with Viranus Donton. Yes -- the guildmaster's son.
You're to accompany him, and make sure he succeeds. He needs some time in the field, to get his confidence up, or he'll never become a good warrior. Vilena coddles the boy too much. Doesn't want him in the line of fire. Suppose it's no surprise after Vitellus.
Vitellus was Vilena Donton's eldest son. Good man. We lost him on a botched mission recently. You've probably seen the other wounded around. If you're smart, you'll steer clear of the subject around the guildmaster. Perhaps you and I will have time to discuss it more later.
Viranus' mother's been holding him back, protecting him. You'll go to Nonwyll Cavern with him. Galtus Previa was lost there, and you're to find him. And not a word of this to the guildmaster! Go find him. He'll be in the Donton house, most likely. And bring him back in one piece!

plots: the player survived Fazeer Shah's first task with the Tu'tara
title: The Djinni's Next Task
objective: complete Fazeer Shah's second task
description:
You survived the Tu'tara more or less in one piece. Congratulations. But it occurs to me that you didn't do anything that you wouldn't ordinarily have done. This second task should prove much more amusing.
Step through the Portal. Your second task... is to survive!

plots: there are no Necromancers involved in this task
title: Vahtacen's Secret
objective: help with Irlav Jarol's research project at Vahtacen
description:
I, Raminus Polus, have a new task for you, and I assure you there are no Necromancers involved.
There's a research project going on at Vahtacen, one of the Ayleid ruin sites on the eastern side of the province. Irlav Jarol is in charge of the project, and is apparently in need of some help.
I thought you might need a break, after the things you've been exposed to lately. You can find Irlav here in the Arch Mage's Tower.

plots: Bolli will fire Wujeeta if she shows up for work under the influence of Skooma
title: Helping Hand
objective: help Wujeeta cure her Skooma addiction
description:
My job at the Riften Fishery is in danger. The owner, Bolli, said that if I show up for work in this condition one more time, then I'm out.
I don't mean to do this to myself, but I can't help it. I tried some Skooma a year ago, and ever since then, I can't stop! If you could give me a healing potion, I could cleanse this poison from my body and get back to my life.

plots: NONE
title: Black Book
objective: learn the secrets of a Black Book
description:
I know things. Hidden things. Things you aren't supposed to know.
I'm not alright! No! That's what I'm trying to say. The secrets. They're in there. In there deep. Can't get them out. They're in my head. They might leak out. Don't want them crawling into your head, too. Like me.
The Black Book taught me the secrets. It shoved them in my head. With black slick fingers. My fingers are too short. I can't get them out. I didn't find the Black Book. It found me. Here. I'll show you. See. Right there, in White Ridge Barrow. But don't go there. You don't want these things in your head. You don't!

plots: NONE
title: Culling the Beast
objective: kill thin-blooded vampires
description:
A bunch of feral vampires are running wild, upsetting the mortals. When the prey is riled, it makes things difficult for us.
Go cull the brutish beasts in Haemar's Shame before the problem gets out of hand. At first you may pity the thin-bloods. But after disposing of a few, you realize they aren't worth the worry.

plots: NONE
title: Rescue
objective: rescue Farkas from a group of necromancers
tasks: kill the vampire leading the group of necromancers
description:
Arkay has some grave news, friend. Your friend, Farkas, kidnapped! A vicious night stalker rules over a group of necromancers - seeks to gain leverage over the righteous.
Arkay's never clear on life and death. Is he still alive? There's always hope... Go to Morvunskar, kill the vampire, and try to save Farkas.

plots: the player can't kill anyone who lives in the house or they forfeit the payment
title: The Burglary Job
objective: commit a burglary
tasks: break into a house, and steal a specific item
description:
I have a little job for you. Pretty simple. Break into a house, grab a specific item and get out before they realize what's going on.
The catch is you can't kill anyone who lives there or you forfeit the payment. You ready for some good old-fashioned burglary?

plots: NONE
title: Perilous Passage
objective: save the Mana Queen
tasks: go through the gate to the Forsaken Vaults
description:
The Mana Queen has come and gone
Through this gate, she journeyed on.
Follow her and pay the cost.
Hasten forth, or she'll be lost.

plots: NONE
title: Extracting an Argonian
objective: rescue Derkeethus
description:
There's a cave known as the Darkwater Pass south of here. It has its share of water pools and high falls.
Those falls... dangerous place. A friend of mine, Derkeethus, thought he could find some good fish in the pools. Haven't heard from him in a long while.
Could you try to find him? He might need someone to rescue him.

plots: Big Head will give the player his charm so that the player can speak with Bolwing
title: The Fork of Horripilation
objective: find the Fork of Horripilation for Big Head
tasks: talk to Bolwing to hear his secret
description:
Sing for Big Head.
The Fork for Big Head. Oh, where has Master put the Fork? It sings alone. Far from home. Sad, sad Fork. Sad, sad Big Head.
The Fork! The precious, precious fork! Hear how it sings to Big Head! Beautiful, perfect Fork of Horripilation! But it is gone. Gone, gone, gone. No more singing. No more ringing. Taken from Big Head, never returned. That is when Big Head came here. Master brought me! Whispered shouts into my ear! Songs of Madgods! Songs of bad gods! Softly, Master. Softly.
It went away. But it will come back! It always comes back! It is close. Big Head can hear it! The Fork of Horripilation! Hear it singing! Songs of home! It comes again. It brings presents! It is not present. Soon it will be! You will find it! Bring the Fork! Hear the music. Music of toads. Music of roads! Sing to yourself, so all can hear!
Talk to the beggar! Talk to Bolwing! He knows secrets, but no one can hear them. No one but Big Head. Take Big Head's charm! Listen to Bolwing! His tongue is tied, but his mind is unraveled! He'll tell you the secret. Who has the Fork?

plots: the player is meeting Paarthurnax for the first time: the player is the Dovahkiin
title: The Throat of the World
objective: receive a lesson from Paarthurnax
tasks: hear Paarthurnax's shout, and match it with your own
description:
Greetings, traveler. I am Paarthurnax. Who are you? What brings you to my mountain? Forgive me. I gave in to the temptation to prolong our speech. I know you are Dovahkiin.
You have come here to learn from me. Patience. There are formalities that must be observed, at the first meeting of two of the dragons. By long tradition, the elder speaks first. Hear my shout! Feel it in your bones.
Match it, if you are Dovahkiin!

plots: the Alchemist came through the Imperial Camp an hour ago: he went through the Great Door and sealed it behind him
the Great Door leads to the Clockwork Core
title: Some Assembly Required
objective: open the Great Door
tasks: find a power source for the dwarven automaton
description:
I wish you had gotten here sooner! The Alchemist came through here about an hour ago. He laid waste to the camp and then went through the Great Door, there - sealed it shut behind him.
We believe that door leads to the Clockwork Core. We've been unable to open it ourselves, but we know how in theory. See that dwarven automaton? It's designed to open the door, but it's missing its Power Source. There should be one in the Scrapworks, but it was too dangerous for us to enter. Perhaps you will have more luck.

plots: Shadr thinks that Sapphire cheated him: Shadr ordered a shipment from the Whiterun stables, it never came
title: Stabilized
objective: help Shadr clear his debt with Sapphire
tasks: talk with Sapphire about Shadr's debt
description:
I owe a great deal of money to someone and I think they cheated me. I don't know what to do.
I was able to work out a deal with the stables in Whiterun to sell me some of their tack and harnesses. I borrowed some gold from Sapphire to pay for the shipment, but it got robbed before it even arrived. Now Sapphire wants her money back, and if I don't pay her, I think she's going to kill me.
Can you help me pay off my debt? You should go talk with Sapphire about it.
